children.definition: woo or court for another, Pl. Tht. 150a; τινί τινα Luc. Herod. 6; ἡ προμνησαμένη, = προμνήστρια, X. Mem. 2.6.36: metaph., Pl. Tht. 151b; προμνᾶταί τί μοι γνώμα my mind woos me to hope, c. inf., S. OC 1075: c. dat., woo themes for others, Pl. Mx. 239c.
endeavour to obtain, solicit, τοιαῦτα π. ἑκάστῳ προσιών X. An. 7.3.18; π. αὐτῷ Κιλικίαν solicit it for him, Plu. Luc. 6; κωφότητα π. Id. Aud. 2.38b.
mention before, PMasp. 32.66 ( Pass., vi A.D.), etc.
Alciphr. 1.37:— Pass., -μνηστευθεῖσα τῷ βασιλεῖ App. Reg. 1.
fitted to woo for another: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the art of match-making, Pl. Tht. 150a.
one by one, one after the other, προμνηστῖναι ἐπήϊσαν Od. 11.233; προμνηστῖνοι ἐσέλθετε 21.230.
woman who woos or courts for another, matchmaker, Ar. Nu. 41, Pl. Tht. 149d, Luc. Dear.Iud. [DDeor. 20.]16: metaph., ἡ κακῶν π. E. Hipp. 589; προμνηστρίας is prob. for -ίδας in X. Mem. 2.6.36.
before the destined term, i.e. untimely, of death, Ael. Fr. 49, Man. 1.276.

doomed to untimely death, AP 11.159 ( Lucill.); in epitaphs, dead before their time, Epigr. Gr. 418 ( Cyrene), IG 14.1386.3 ( Alba), 1521 ( Rome). Adv. -ρως ib. 1932 (ibid.), BMus.Inscr. 794.10 ( Cnidus).
procure a woman by adultery, Ποππαίαν Νέρωνι Plu. Galb. 19.

approach, vestibule, A.R. 1.1174: elsewh. in pl., Call. Dian. 142, A.R. 1.260, 320, 4.1160; of the foot of a mountain, AP 7.9 ( Damag.), Call. Dian. 99; mouth of a river, AP 7.246 ( Antip. Sid.), Opp. C. 2.134.

foremost man, in Hom. always = πρόμαχος, Il. 15.293, Od. 11.493, al.; π. ἀνήρ Il. 5.533; π. τινί opposed to another in the front rank, 7.75, 116, 22.85: later, generally, chief, A. Ag. 200 (lyr.), 410 (lyr.); Ἀχαιῶν . . πρόμοι Id. Eu. 399; γᾶς πρόμοι S. OC 884 (lyr.); στρατιῆς π. AP 7.233 ( Apollonid.); Ἀθηναίων E. Tr. 31; τῶν Πανελλήνων πρόμῳ Κίμωνι prob. in Cratin. 1; πάντων θεῶν θεὸς π., of the sun, S. OT 660 (lyr.), cf. Epigr.Gr. 361 ( Phrygia); ἰατρῶν π. prob. ib. 352 ( Claudiopolis). The forms πρόμνος, A. Supp. 904 (lyr.), and πράμος, Ar. Th. 50, are corrupt.
planting out of cuttings, Gloss.
plant out cuttings, Thphr. HP 6.7.3, CP 3.5.3.
embankment, quay, POxy. 1911.167 (vi A.D.); -ος as gloss on πρόβολος, Hsch.; cf. πρόμωλον.
work beforehand, E. Supp. 1234 (anap.).
beam-ends projecting over the wall, SIG 977a8 ( Delos, ii B.C.), Hsch.
initiate beforehand, in aor. Med., prob. for προθυμησαμένη in Hsch. s.v. προτελειωσαμένη.
previous initiation, π. τοῦ θανάτου ὁ ὕπνος Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.107e.
privilege of speaking first, π. πρὸς μαντείην,= προμαντεία, Hp. Ep. 27.

definition: προμυθίκτρια, ἡ, Dor. for προμνήστρια, Poll. 3.31.

children.definition: moral prefixed to a fable, Aphth. Prog. 1, Donat. ad Ter. Eun. 232: title of a work by Sophron, Cod.Paris. in Cohn Zu den Parömiographen 82.
promunctorium, Gloss.
goddess who presides over mills, Poll. 7.180; expld. by θεὸς προμύλιος, Phot.
pout the lips, Hp. VM 22.
perfume beforehand, in Pass., Thphr. Od. 45.
snuff a lamp, τὸν λύχνον Ar. V. 249 (prob. for πρόβυσον, cf. Sch.ad loc., Poll. 2.72, 6.103), Plu. Praec. 2.798b.
extort money from, τινα Hp. Praec. 4.
λύχνον ἑαυτὸν προμύσσοντα a lamp which trims itself, pushes out its own wick, dub. cj. for προσμύσσοντα in Hero Spir. 1.34.
initiator, App.Anth. 3.115c ( Eleusis); fem. πρόμυστις, Jahrb. 27.10 ( Thasos).
groan or roar before, Hsch., Phot.
promunctorium (leg. promontorium), Gloss.; cf. πρόμουλον.

definition: πρόναος, or προναῖος, α, ον, Ion. προνήϊος, η, ον, Att. πρόνεως: ( ναός):—

children.definition: before a temple, βωμοὺς προνάους A. Supp. 494: esp. of gods whose statues stood before the temple, Ἀθηνᾶ καὶ Ἑρμῆς πρόναοι at Thebes, Paus. 9.10.2; πρόνεως, epith. of Poseidon, Hsch.; freq. of Athena at Delphi, because she had a chapel or statue there before the great temple of Apollo, κατὰ τὸ ἱρὸν τῆς Προνηΐης Ἀθηναίης Hdt. 8.37, cf. 39; ἐν δὲ Προνηΐης τῆς ἐν Δελφοῖσι Id. 1.92; Παλλὰς προναία A. Eu. 21; ἐναγὴς ἔστω τοῦ Ἀπόλλωνος . . καὶ Ἀθηνᾶς Προναίας Decr. Amphict. ap. Aeschin. 3.110 ( Προνοίας codd., so also in 108, al., but cf. Harp.); χἡ Παλλάς, Δελφοί νιν ὅθʼ ἱδρύοντο προναίην Call. Fr. 220; Ἀθηνᾷ Προναίᾳ SIG 324 ( Delph., iv B.C.), cf. Schwyzer 323 D 35 (ibid., iv B.C.).

data.quote: κατὰ τὸ ἱρὸν τῆς Προνηΐης Ἀθηναίης
ἐν δὲ Προνηΐης τῆς ἐν Δελφοῖσι
χἡ Παλλάς, Δελφοί νιν ὅθʼ ἱδρύοντο προναίην

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. πρόναος, ὁ, front hall of a temple, through which one passed to the ναός, BMus.Inscr. 481*.272,283 ( Ephesus, ii A.D.); Ion. πρόνηος Luc. Syr.D. 30; Att. dat. written προνεοι IG 1(2).237.58, προνειοι ib. 232.6 (prob. to be understood as πρόνεῳ and πρόνειῳ); Ion. gen. προνηΐου Hdt. 1.51: pl. προνήϊα, as Adv., before the temple, AP 6.281 ( Leon.): also neut. πρόναον, τό, Str. 17.1.28, Ph. 2.150, 236, Paus. 8.32.2 codd., OGI 661 ( Egypt, i A.D.), 702 (ibid., ii A.D.), Ath.Mitt. 35.442 ( Pergam., ii A.D.), Milet. 1(7) No.200 (iii A.D.), Ephes. 2 No.42 (iii A.D.), IGRom. 4.556 ( Ancyra): gender uncertain in προνάοις D.S. 14.41; προνάϊον, IG 5(2).515 Ba ( Lycosura, i B.C. i A.D.), 520 (ibid., ii A.D.), 7.225 ( Aegosthena), J. AJ 8.3.2 (v.l. πρόναον); προνάειν, Jahresh. 15 Beibl. 106 ( Dionysopolis, iii A.D.). (The forms Προναια, προναιην, προναιον should perh. be understood as Προνᾴα, προνᾴην, πρόνᾳον: the word is trisyll. in A. and Call. ll. cc.)
act for one as shipmaster, Bull.Soc.Roy.des lettres de Lund 1928/9 iv 48 ( Prote).
one who acts for a shipmaster, IG 12 (8).585 ( Thasos); gloss on ἐπίσκοπος, Sch. Od. 8.163; = magister navis, Gloss.
fight at sea for or in defence of, Μιλήτου Hdt. 6.7; Πελοποννήσου Id. 8.60.β.
assign beforehand, τινί τι Pi. I. 8(7).18; καθαρὰς χεῖρας π. present unspotted hands, A. Eu. 313 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., go forward in grazing: hence, gain ground, spread, π. Ἄρης S. El. 1384 (lyr.).
go forward, Opp. H. 3.238.

stoop or bend forward, προνενευκὼς εἰς τὸ πρόσθεν Pl. Euthd. 274b; of a rider, X. Eq. 8.7; of rowers, Id. Oec. 8.8, Plb. 1.21.2; of horns, Arist. HA 611b5; of promontories, Poll. 1.115 cod. B, Suid. s.v. πρῆνες; of a wrestler, Gal. 6.142 (v.l. προσ-).
heap up before, App. BC 4.80.
swim before, Ael. NA 2.6.
veranda, Sammelb. 5231.3 (i A.D.), PLond. 2.262.1 (i A.D.), etc.
fast before, Hdt. 2.40, Hp. Nat.Mul. 95.
swim before, Plu. Sollert. 2.980f, Ael. NA 10.8: c. gen., τοῦ στόλου Plu. Sollert. 2.984a.
wash beforehand, only in 1 aor. part. Med. -νιψάμενος, Aët. 16.17.
gain a victory beforehand, Th. 2.89 ( Act. and Pass.), Is. 11.18, etc.
Archig. ap. Paul.Aeg. 4.6, Thessal. ap. Harpocr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).148.
Rev.Bibl. 41.412 ( Syria).

perceive before, foresee, δόλον Il. 18.526, cf. Pi. P. 10.63; προνοῆσαι βραδεῖς τὰ . . ἀποβησόμενα Th. 3.38; τὸ μέλλον ἔσεσθαι Arist. Cael. 291a24; προνοῶν ὅτι ἀνάγκη ἔσοιτο foreseeing that . . , X. Cyr. 8.1.13; of divine foreknowledge, θεῖος νοῦς νοεῖ μὲν ὡς νοῦς, προνοεῖ δὲ ὡς θεός Procl. Inst. 134, cf. Plot. 4.8.2.

data.quote: θεῖος νοῦς νοεῖ μὲν ὡς νοῦς, προνοεῖ δὲ ὡς θεός

children.label: b
children.definition: preconceive, Porph. Sent. 26.

children.label: II
children.definition: think of or plan beforehand, provide, οὐ . . τι πάρα προνοῆσαι ἄμεινον Od. 5.364; opp. μετανοέω, Epich. 280; π. τὸ παραγγελλόμενον attend to it, X. Cyr. 4.1.6: abs., to be on oneʼs guard, take precautions, ὥρα προνοεῖν πρὶν πελάσαι στρατόν E. Heracl. 289; περαιτέρω π. Th. 3.43; π. καὶ προβουλεύεσθαι X. Mem. 2.10.3: folld. by relat. Adv., π. ὅπως . . provide, take care that . . , Id. Eq.Mag. 4.1; π. μὴ . . , or ὡς μὴ . . , cavere ne . . , Id. Oec. 9.11, Cyr. 1.6.24; π. ὅτι . . pay due regard to the fact that . . , Th. 3.58.

provide for, take thought for, τῶν παίδων X. Cyr. 8.1.1, cf. 8.7.15, etc.; θεὸς π. τῶν ὅλων Arr. Epict. 2.14.11, Procl. Inst. 120; μάλιστα δὲ προνόησον Ἀρσινόης PHal. 1.179 (iii B.C.); opp. ὀλιγωρεῖν, Str. 5.3.8:— Pass., Procl. Inst. 122.
Pass., to be provided, τὰ -ούμενα, of a poetʼs equipment, Phld. Po. 5.3; of a patient, to be treated, Gal. 2.632; receive consideration, PGiss. 7.23 (ii A.D.).

children.label: III
children.definition: CIG 3408 (Magn.Sip.).

children.label: B
children.definition: Att. writers (also Inscrr. and Pap., v. infr.) prefer Med. προνοοῦμαι, Th. 6.9, etc. (so also X. An. 7.7.33, Mem. 4.3.12): fut. -ήσομαι D. Prooem. 43, IG 2(2).1035.18, D.H. 8.90, etc.: aor. προὐνοησάμην E. Hipp. 399, Ar. Eq. 421, Antipho 5.43; in Prose mostly προὐνοήθην, Pl. Cra. 395c, Lys. 3.29, Is. 2.46, D. 44.64, PSI 3.166.34 (ii B. C.) (used in pass. sense by S.E. M. 9.404, Gal. 2.632): pf. προνενόημαι Plb. 6.48.2, D.S. 12.69 (but inf. πεπρονοῆσθαι 17.23), etc.—The sense and constr. are the same as in the Act.: provide, ταῦτα Th. 4.61, cf. Is. l.c., D. 44.64, etc.; οὐδέν Pl. l.c.; οἰκίδιόν τινι D.L. 6.23; τὰ συμφέροντα ὑπὲρ τῶν μελλόντων X. Mem. l.c.: abs., Lys. 3.29, etc.; π. περὶ τούτων ib. 37; ὑπὲρ ὑμῶν καὶ τῆς πόλεως Id. 26.15, cf. D. 14.4: c. inf., take care to do, E. l.c., Antipho l.c.; π. μή c. inf., D. 23.135; π. ὅπως . . Lys. 3.41; ὅτι . . Plb. 38.16.1; ἵνα . . Inscr.Prien. 27.12 (ii B. C.).
provide for, Th. 6.9, etc.; τοῦ μέλλοντος And. 4.12; τῆς χώρας X. An. 7.7.33; superintend, τῆς οἰκοδομίας Haussoullier Milet p.252; τῆς ἀναστάσεως τοῦ ἀνδριάντος CIG 2930b10 ( Tralles).
office of administrator, POxy. 136.9 (vi A. D.).
one must provide, X. Oec. 7.36, Onos. 7.2, Jul. Or. 2.88a.

children.label: II
children.definition: one must take thought for, Ph. 2.318, al., Gal. 6.452, Orib. Fr. 70; ἑαυτῶν Ruf. ap. Orib. inc. 9.1.

children.label: III
children.definition: inf., one must take care to, Herod.Med. ap. Aët. 4.47.
hold the office of προνοητής, CIG 2639 ( Cyprus).

supervisor, administrator, πάντων OGI 660.8 ( Egypt, i A. D.); of estates, PLond. 2.214 (iii A. D.); ταμίας καὶ π., of Hermes, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.44; curator of public buildings, etc., CIG 4591 ( Palestine); γυμνασίου PGrenf. 2.67 (iii A.D.).

provident, cautious, wary, X. Mem. 1.3.9, Men. Epit. 344; τὸ πόρρωθεν π. M.Ant. 1.16: Comp. -ώτερος Procop. Arc. 19. Adv. -κῶς X. Mem. 1.4.6, Aen.Tact. 18.11, Ph. 1.500, Sor. 1.14; π. ἔχειν Aristid. 1.377 J.; π. ἔχειν τινός J. AJ 11.5.8: Sup. -ώτατα most wisely, A.D. Pron. 104.13.

taking thought or care for, esp. of divine providence, θεὸς π. κόσμου D.L. 7.147, cf. Str. 10.3.23, Ph. 2.242; φύσις π. τοῦ ζῴου Gal. 11.158: abs., ἔχειν π. δύναμιν περὶ τὸν αὑτῶν βίον Arist. EN 1141a28, cf. Ph. 2.546, Plu. Stoic.rep. 2.1052b, Procl. Inst. 120: Comp. -ώτερος Chio Ep. 15.2.

data.quote: ἔχειν π. δύναμιν περὶ τὸν αὑτῶν βίον

children.label: II
children.definition: showing forethought or design, X. Mem. 4.3.6.
perceiving beforehand, foresight, foreknowledge, τοὖπος τὸ θεοπρόπον τᾶς παλαιφάτου π. S. Tr. 823 (lyr.); προνοίαισι τοῦ πεπρωμένου A. Ag. 684 (lyr.).

data.quote: τοὖπος τὸ θεοπρόπον τᾶς παλαιφάτου π.

children.label: II
children.definition: foresight, forethought, ἐπῄνεσʼ . . πρόνοιαν ἣν ἔθου S. Aj. 536; π. δʼ ἐστὶν οὐδενὸς σαφής Id. OT 978; προνοίας οὕνεκα so far as foresight, caution is required, Id. Ph. 774, cf. El. 1015; ἐκ προνοίης with forethought, purposely, Hdt. 1.120, 159, etc.; opp. κατὰ τύχην, Id. 8.87, cf. Antipho 5.21, Lys. 26.19, Pl. Phdr. 241e; ἀπὸ προνοίας τινῶν by their precautions, Th. 8.95; τὴν π. τὴν ἐς ἡμέας ἔχουσαν Hdt. 8.144; προνοίᾳ τῶν συγγενῶν, φίλων, τῆς πόλεως, by care for . . , And. 1.56; esp. of crimes committed with design or malice prepense, ἐκ προνοίας τραῦμα, ἐκ π. φόνοι, Aeschin. 3.212, Din. 1.6, etc.; ἐκ π. ἀποθνῄσκειν Antipho 1.22, cf. Lys. 3.28; τὰ ἐκ π., opp. ἀκούσια, Arist. Pol. 1300b26; so οὐδεμία π. ἐστι τραύματος no intention of wounding, Lys. 3.41; πρόνοιαν ἔχειν (or ἴσχειν) τινός to take thought for . . , show care for . . , E. Alc. 1061, Th. 2.89, etc.; περί τινος S. Ant. 283; ὑπέρ τινος Isoc. 16.9; ἡ τοῦ χόρτου π. PFlor. 131.7 (iii A. D.), cf. 148.2 (iii A. D.): c. inf., πολλὴν π. εἶχεν εὐσχήμως (fort. εὐσχήμων) πεσεῖν E. Hec. 569; πολλὴν π. ἔχειν μέλλοντας . . to be ware of doing a thing, Antipho 5.91; π. ποιεῖσθαί τινος D. 21.97, etc.: pl., X. Oec. 7.38.

data.quote: τὴν π. τὴν ἐς ἡμέας ἔχουσαν

children.definition: providence, τοῦ θείου ἡ π. Hdt. 3.108; τοῦ θεοῦ S. OC 1180; θεία π. E. Ph. 637 (troch.); πρόνοιαι θεῶν Pl. Ti. 44c: abs., divine providence, προνοίας ἔργῳ X. Mem. 1.4.6, etc., cf. Zeno Stoic. 1.44, Cleanth. ib. 121, Chrysipp. ib. 2.168, al. ( περὶ προνοίας as title of one of his works, ib. 3.203).
Pythag. name for five, Theol.Ar. 31.
office of προνοητής, POxy. 472.10 (ii A. D.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Πρόνοια Ἀθηνᾶ Athena as goddess of Forethought, under which name she was worshipped at Delphi, D. 25.34, D.S. 11.14, Parth. 25, Paus. 10.8.6, Plu. Praec. 2.825b, Jul. Or. 4.149b, etc.; at Delos acc. to Macr. Sat. 1.17.55, cf. Aristid. 1.97 J., Or. 37(2).26; also Ἰουλία θεὰ Σεβαστὴ Π. IG 3.461: this name of Athena, which is guaranteed by the context in D., Aristid., Jul., Macr. ll. cc., seems to have been a distortion of the name Προναία or Προνᾴα (v. πρόναος I), but πρόνοια is f.l. for Προναία (or Προνᾴα) in Aeschin. (v. πρόναος 1), and D.S., Parth., Paus., Plu. ll. cc. shd. perh. be corrected.
Ph. 2.512, Plu. Alex. 60, Luc. Zeux. 10, etc.; of a flyʼs proboscis, Id. Musc.Enc. 6; of a beeʼs, Philostr. Im. 2.12.
going out to forage or plunder, Plb. 4.68.3 (v.l. προνομαί): rejected by Thom.Mag. p.275R.
forager, plunderer, Str. 15.3.7.
forage, plunder, Plb. 2.27.2, Str. 16.1.18, Onos. 10.8, Polyaen. 3.10.5; [ προβοσκίδα] ἔχουσα π., of a fly, Luc. Musc.Enc. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: plunder, ravage, τὴν τῶν πολεμίων D.H. 8.11 (also in Pass., ibid., D.S. 13.109); pluck, ὄρμενα Posidipp. 24; eat greedily, τὰ δεῖπνα Plu. QConv. 2.709a.
carry away captive, LXX Nu. 31.9, al.:— Pass., ib. Si. 48.15. (Rejected by Thom.Mag. p.275 R.)

foraging, ἐξάγειν εἰς προνομάς X. Cyr. 6.1.24; foray, προνομὴν or προνομὰς ποιεῖσθαι, Id. HG 1.1.33, 2.4.25, cf. Aen. Tact. 31.8; πεδία προνομὰς ἔχοντα suitable for foraging, Plu. Fab. 6; provision of fodder, PFlor. 388.81 (ii A. D.).
foraging parties, σὺν προνομαῖς τὰ ἐπιτήδεια λαμβάνειν X. HG 4.1.16, An. 5.1.7, cf. Plb. 4.73.4.
plunder, booty, LXX Nu. 31.11, al., Phleg. Mir. 3.
store, provision, LXX 3 Ki. 10.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: proboscis (cf. προνομαία), Plb. 5.84.3, D.S. 17.88 (pl.).

children.label: III
children.definition: = sq. 1, Luc. Sat. 17.
privilege, Ph. 1.6, al., Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.279b, 296c (pl.), PFlor. 382.14 (iii A. D.), Lyd. Mag. 3.24, etc.; π. διδόναι τινί Str. 15.1.54, Luc. Abd. 23, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: νομός) right of pasturage, IG 9(1).442 (Acarn., iv B. C.).
song sung before the νόμος (signf. II), Poll. 4.53: metaph., Jul. Or. 2.56d (pl.): also as Adj., π. μέλος Him. Or. 4.3, cf. 34.1.
earnest-money, Luc. Rh.Pr. 17.

children.label: II
children.definition: = foreg. [προνομία] I, privilege, POxy. 136.38 (vi A. D.), Suid.
make a law before, Suid. s.v. προθεσμία:— Pass., to be established by law before, Milet. 3 No.134.17, D.C. 36.39.
grazing forward, opp. ὀπισθονόμος (q. v.): generally, π. βοτά grazing Herds, A. Supp. 691 (lyr.).
careful, prudent, A. Supp. 969 (anap.), Hdt. 3.36: Comp. -νούστερος S. Aj. 119.
to be ill beforehand, Hp. Coac. 534.
wet, moisten beforehand, in Pass., Dsc. 2.83, Archig. ap. Orib. 8.2.7.
the day before a new moon, LXX Ju. 8.6.
pre-nuptial, π. ὕπνον ἰαῦσαι Call. Aet. 3.1.2 [Fr. 75.2 Pf.].
all night long, opp. προῆμαρ, Semon. 7.47.
goad on, Plb. 28.17.8.

stooping forwards, with head inclined, στείχει π., of one in deep grief, E. Alc. 186; π. ἐστι καὶ ψυχορραγεῖ, of one dying, ib. 143; π. λαβεῖν to take her as she fell fainting forward, of the ministers of the altar taking up lphigenia, A. Ag. 234 (lyr.).
inclined, ready, ἄγαν π. ἐς τὸ λοιδορεῖν φέρῃ E. Andr. 729. (Cf. νωπέομαι.)

data.quote: ἄγαν π. ἐς τὸ λοιδορεῖν φέρῃ

children.definition: front of a house (cf. ἐνώπια) , ἐς προνώπιʼ αὐτίχʼ ἥξει E. Ba. 639 (troch.): metaph. in sg., τόδʼ ἔσχατον . . χώρας Πελοπίας π., of Troezen, the outer portal of Peloponnesus, Id. Hipp. 374.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., πῶς προνώπιος φαίνῃ πρὸς οἴκοις . .; in front, before the door, Id. Ba. 645.
ἥρωες π., = Lares compitales, D.H. 4.14. (Acc. to Eust. for πρό, ἐνώπια, i.e. τὰ πρὸ τῶν ἐνωπίων: but the etym. is doubtful.)

roe deer, Cervus capreolus, αἶγας ἐπʼ ἀγροτέρας ἠδὲ πρόκας ἠδὲ λαγωούς Od. 17.295; coupled with ἔλαφος by Arist. HA 506a22, 515b34, PA 676b27, Dionys.Ath. and Philet. ap. Sch. A.R. 2.279; but expld. as τὸ τέκνον τῆς δορκάδος by Sch. Nic. Th. 578, cf. Sch. Od. l.c.:—also προκάς (q. v.).

data.quote: αἶγας ἐπʼ ἀγροτέρας ἠδὲ πρόκας ἠδὲ λαγωούς

children.definition: coward, Archil. 188.

definition: πρόξεινος, ὁ, Ion. for πρόξενος (q. v.).
προξενέω, impf. προὐξένουν (but ἐπροξένει E. Fr. 1104, Ar. Fr. 775): fut. προξενήσω: pf. προὐξένηκα:—

children.definition: to be any oneʼs πρόξενος (q. v.), διὰ τὸ προξενεῖν ὑμῶν because he is your πρόξενος, X. HG 6.4.24, cf. D. 15.15, etc.; π. τῶν πρέσβεων act as π. of the envoys of a friendly state, Id. 18.82.
to be oneʼs protector, patron, E. Med. 724, Ar. Th. 576.

children.label: II
children.definition: πρόξενος (signf. II),

manage or effect anything for another, τἄλλα E. Ion 335; θράσος π. lend daring, S. Tr. 726; π. τιμήν, εὐδαιμονίαν τινί, procure it for him, Plu. Caes. 60, Luc. Vit.Auct. 10; φιλίας βασιλέων Plu. Sol. 2; ὄψις π. ἡδονήν Aristid. Or. 53(55).4; γυναῖκας ἐπιπόνους, ἄνδρας συστατικούς, Procl. Par.Ptol. 255, 256; οὐδεμίαν ὠφέλειαν Gal. 6.830: in bad sense, π. κίνδυνόν τινι put danger upon one, X. An. 6.5.14, cf. Ael. VH 13.33; π. ὀνείδη, ἀνάγκας τινί, Plu. Alex. 22, Aristid. 1.488 J.: c. dat. et inf., ὑμῖν ὧδʼ ὁρᾶν τὰ πρόσθε λαμπρὰ προὐξένησαν ὄμματα have granted to you to see thus my once bright eyes, S. OT 1483; π. τινὶ τὸ καταλῦσαι βίον grant one to die, X. Ap. 7; π. τινί guide one, give him directions, S. OC 465.

introduce, recommend one person to another, commonly for purposes of business, μὴ πονηρούς, ὦ πονήρα, προξένει Eup. 321; λέγων οἷον ἄνθρωπον προὐξένησέ μοι D. 37.11, cf. 53.13; σὺ προξένησον introduce me (to the oracle), E. Hel. 146; π. τινὰ διδάσκαλον, φοιτητήν, introduce him as teacher, as pupil, Pl. La. 180c, Alc. 1.109d; π. κόρην τινί Longus 3.36, cf. Him. Or. 1.11; also π. βωμόν Lib. Ep. 739.1.

children.label: III
children.definition: give evidence, Hsch.; π. ἐπὶ κακῷ IG 92(1).138.9 ( Calydon, iv B. C.); αἰ ψευδέα προξενέοι ib. 9(1).333.8 ( Locr., v B. C.).
public reception, Sch. Pi. O. 3. Prooem. (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: = conciliation, Gloss.
broker, agent, CIG 2942 ( Tralles); σωμάτων slave- broker, OGI 524.2 (pl., Thyatira); [ γάμου] Cod.Just. 5.1.6.1.
of or for a broker, τὸ π. brokerage, Cod.Just. 5.1 tit. (pl., as Lat. word).
Ar. Nu. 41.

definition: προξενία, Thess. προξεννία IG 9(2).258.6,9 ( Cierium, ii B. C.): ἡ:—

children.definition: relation of πρόξενος, treaty or compact of friendship between a state and a foreigner, Antipho Fr. 67, Th. 6.89; προξενίᾳ πέποιθα I trust my public friendship, Pi. N. 7.65, cf. O. 9.83; τινὰ π. ἐξευρήσεις; what protector wilt thou find? E. Med. 359 (anap., v.l.).

status and privileges of a πρόξενος, π., εὐεργεσία, ἀπέλεια ἁπάντων D. 20.60; τὴν παλαιὰν π . . . ἣν τοῦ πάππου ἀπειπόντος αὐτὸς [sc. ὁ Ἀλκιβιάδης . . διενοεῖτο ἀνανεώσασθαι Th. 5.43; τὴν π. ὑμῶν . . πατρὸς πατὴρ πατρῴαν ἔχων παρεδίδου τῷ γένει X. HG 6.3.4; ἡ πρὸς Θηβαίους π. Aeschin. 2.141; freq. in Inscrr., IG 1(2).116.40, etc.; coupled with other privileges, e.g. προνομία, προπραξία, ib. 9(1).442.4 ( Stratos, iv B. C.); πολιτεία, ἀσυλία ib. 9(2).62.12 ( Lamia, iii B. C.), etc.; ἔγγυος τᾶς π. ib. 14; ἔγγυος τᾶν π. ὁ γραμματεύς SIG 629.31 ( Delph., ii B. C.).

data.quote: τὴν π. ὑμῶν . . πατρὸς πατὴρ πατρῴαν ἔχων παρεδίδου τῷ γένει

children.label: II
children.definition: inscription or written instrument in witness of προξενία, in pl., Arist. Ath. 54.3, Plb. 12.11.2.
cause, αὑτῷ λύπην Anon. in EN 436.24.

definition: πρόξενος ( πρόξενφος IG 9(1).867 (Corc., vii/vi B. C.)), Cret. πρόξηνος GDI 5028 A 2,6, Schwyzer 187 (ii B. C.), Ion. πρόξεινος Hdt. (v. infr.): ὁ ( ἡ, when used of a woman, v. infr. II):—

children.definition: public ξένος, public guest or friend, made so by an act of the State: Alexander I of Macedon was π. καὶ εὐεργέτης of Athens, Hdt. 8.136, cf. 143; πρόξενοι ἀμφικτιόνων Pi. I. 4(3).8; εἶναι πρόξενον τοῦ δήμου τοῦ Ἀθηναίων Στράτωνα τὸν Σιδῶνος βασιλέα καὶ αὐτὸν καὶ ἐκγόνους IG 2(2).141.9; πρόξενοι καὶ πολῖται Lys. 28.1; esp. of persons representing the interests of a foreign state in their own community, Pl. Lg. 642b, etc.; opp. φιδιόξενος (q. v.), IG 9(1).333.11 ( Locr., v B. C.); of π. of Athens in other states, Pindar at Thebes, Isoc. 15.166; Thucydides at Pharsalus, Th. 8.92; π. τῆς πόλεως, i.e. of Athens at Mytilene, Arist. Pol. 1304a10; of other states at Athens, Cimon and Callias of Sparta, And. 3.3, X. HG 5.4.22; Nicias of Syracuse, D.S. 13.27; Thraso of Thebes, Aeschin. 3.138; ὅσους γέγραφε προξένους εἶναι καὶ Ἀθηναίους Din. 1.45; of other states at Sparta, e.g. Lichas of Argos, Th. 5.76; Clearchus of Byzantium, X. HG 1.1.35; π. of barbarian communities and rulers, Id. An. 5.4.2, 5.6.11; sts. the function was exercised by a community, εἶμεν τὰν πόλιν τῶν Δελφῶν πρόξενον τᾶς πόλιος τᾶς Σαρδιανῶν . . διὰ τὸ μὴ ὑπάρχειν πρόξενον Σαρδιανοῖς SIG 548.10 ( Delph., iii B. C.).

data.quote: εἶναι πρόξενον τοῦ δήμου τοῦ Ἀθηναίων Στράτωνα τὸν Σιδῶνος βασιλέα καὶ αὐτὸν καὶ ἐκγόνους
ὅσους γέγραφε προξένους εἶναι καὶ Ἀθηναίους
εἶμεν τὰν πόλιν τῶν Δελφῶν πρόξενον τᾶς πόλιος τᾶς Σαρδιανῶν . . διὰ τὸ μὴ ὑπάρχειν πρόξενον Σαρδιανοῖς

children.label: b
children.definition: patrons or representatives of guilds, e.g. the σύνοδος τοῦ Διὸς τοῦ Ξενίου at Athens, IG 2(2).1012.18, cf.7.2486 ( Thebes), 14.615 ( Rhegium).
Hdt. 6.57; also at Delphi, of persons extending public hospitality, E. Ion 551, 1039, Andr. 1103; so in Nephelococcygia, Ar. Av. 1021.
witnesses to a will, IG 14.636 ( Petelia).

children.label: II
children.definition: patron, protector, A. Supp. 420 (lyr.), al., Ar. Th. 602; φίλης γὰρ π. κατήνυσαν at the house of a kind patroness, i.e. Clytaemnestra, S. El. 1451; προξένῳ χρῆσθαί τινι E. Fr. 721.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adj., assisting, relieving, c. gen., Alciphr. 3.72.
causing, producing, κακῶν, συμπτωμάτων, νόσων, Ruf. Fr. 64, Olymp. in Mete. 3.21, Sch. Ar. Nu. 243.
to be entertained before, c. dat. pers., Str. 1.2.33.
dry first, Gal. 11.701:— Pass., Dsc. 5.75.15, Gal. 11.600.
to be rubbed dry before, Crateuas 9, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.21.4.
shave beforehand, Heraclid.Tar. ap. Gal. 12.402, Crito ib. 484, Alex.Trall. 1.1.
preliminary shaving, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.12.3.
one must shave first, Sever. ap. Aeët. 7.92, Paul.Aeg. 6.4.
Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.12.3 ( Pass.).
bray beforehand, Luc. Asin. 26.
travelling before, Eust. 51.26.

walk first, App. BC 4.43; travel before, Luc. Herm. 73; emanate, prob. in Iamb. VP 17.74; προοδεύει τι τῶν ἐντέρων the patient has a slight motion of the bowels, Paul.Aeg. 3.71: metaph. in fut. Med., -εύσονται εἰς ἄπειρον will go on ad infinitum, Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 288.24.
one who goes before to show the way, τοῦ πολέμου LXX 2 Ma. 12.36.
praevia, Gloss.
proceeding, emanating, Dam. Pr. 44: Comp., ib. 77. Adv. -κῶς ib. 221.
travel before, Luc. Herm. 27; τινι Id. DMar. 15.3 (dub.):— Pass., αὐτῷ προωδοιπόρηται he has gone too far, D.L. 7.176.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be travelled over before, J. AJ 3.1.1.
one who travels before, Hsch. s.v. ὁδουρός.

definition: προοδοποιέω, aor. προωδοποίησα Arist. Pr. 867a39: pf. προωδοποίηκα Id. Rh. 1389b31:— Pass. προωδοποίημαι Id. PA 650b28, 651b10, GA 770b3, al.; so that the forms προωδο-πεποίηκα, -πεποίημαι in Pr. 954b12, Pol. 1270a4, are prob. corrupt:—

children.definition: prepare or pave the way, τὸ γῆρας π. τῇ δειλίᾳ Arist. Rh. l.c.; πάντα π. πρὸς . . make all preparations for . . , Id. Pol. 1336a32; πρὸς τὴν ἀλήθειαν Jul. Or. 7.217c: abs., Plu. QConv. 2.664a:— Med., make oneʼs way, tend in a certain direction, πρὸς τὸ ἄνω Arist. PA 671b31, cf. Pr. 867a36, Thphr. Sud. 28.

children.label: II
children.definition: prepare beforehand, τὸ σῶμα πρὸς τὸ ἱδροῦν Arist. Pr. 867a39; τὴν ψυχὴν εἴς τι S.E. M. 6.34; πολλὰ αὐτῷ (sc. Σόλωνι) τῆς νομοθεσίας Plu. Sol. 12, cf. Lyc. 4:— Pass., αὑτοὺς παρεῖχον τῷ νομοθέτῃ προωδοποιημένους Arist. Pol. 1270a4; π. τῷ πάθει Id. PA 650b28; προωδοποίηται ἕκαστος πρὸς τὴν ἑκάστου ὀργήν Id. Rh. 1379a21, cf. GA 770b3, Epicur. Nat.Herc. 1420.3.

data.quote: προωδοποίηται ἕκαστος πρὸς τὴν ἑκάστου ὀργήν

children.definition: going before to prepare the way: directive, of drugs, Gal. 14.759.
preparing the way, Sch. Ar. Pl. 1160.
going before: οἱ π. advance-party of soldiers, X. Eq.Mag. 4.5. Adv. -ωτέρως progressively, Zos.Alch. p.158B.
going on, advance, Emp. 84.1, X. HG 3.4.15: metaph., progress, Plot. 5.2.1; ἐκ δυνάμεως εἰς ἐνέργειαν Id. 6.3.22.

children.label: II
children.definition: coming out of a house, Luc. Nec. 12; appearance in public, Id. Somn. 9.
procession, J. AJ 18.4.6, lamb.post Polem. p.49 Hinck, Hdn. 2.4.1, Plot. 5.5.3 (pl.), SIG 900.13 ( Panamara, iv A.D.).

proceeding forth, emanation, Plot. 8.5.6, etc.; ἡ ἀφʼ ἑνὸς πάντων π. Procl. in Cra. p.2 P.; opp. μονή, ἐπιστροφή, Dam. Pr. 72, al.: pl., Porph. Sent. 24; π. κρύφιοι, opp. ἐγκόσμιοι, Procl. in Cra. p.107 P.
progression, lamb. VP 26.120 (pl.).
progression, Plot. 6.3.12.
= interrogatio, Gloss.
with prominent teeth, Poll. 2.96 cod.A: also προ-όδων, Phot., Eust. 1872.33; written προώδων Phryn. PS p.101 B.
feel pain before, Gal. 16.557, Sch. Pi. P. 2.166.
lament before, Sch. E. Med. 1016.

definition: πρόοιδα, inf. προειδέναι, part. προειδώς, pf. (with plpf. προῄδη, -ῄδειν, fut. προείσομαι); late aor. inf. προειδῆσαι Phld. Rh. 1.286 S.:—

children.definition: know beforehand, Hdt. 1.20, 7.235, 9.41, And. 2.21, Lys. 16.15, etc.; περὶ τούτων τὴν ἀλήθειαν Pl. Grg. 459e; τὸν θάνατον ib. 523d; ὃν [καιρὸν] οὐ προῄδειν ἐσόμενον Isoc. 12.127; π. ὅτι . . D. 8.50; π. τίς χορηγὸς [ἔσται] Id. 4.36; ἐξ οὐ προειδότος un foreseen, D.C. 69.4: c. part., μὴ ἐπʼ ἀγαθῷ . . κατοικισθησόμενον (sc. τὸ Πελαργικόν) Th. 2.17.
make friendly, win over beforehand, prob. in D.H. 5.64.
dwell before, ἐν τῇ νήσῳ D.S. 15.14.
the projecting eaves of a house, Clitodem. 25 (pl.).
build in front, πρὸ τῶν πύργων τριγώνους Ph. Bel. 84.13:— Pass., dub. in Luc. Alex. 14.
arrange before, J. AJ 2.5.7:— Med., get things previously arranged, Id. BJ 7.8.2:— Pass., to be so arranged, προῳκονόμηται ὑπὸ τοῦ θείου ἑκατέρου ἡ φύσις Arist. Oec. 1343b26.

data.quote: προῳκονόμηται ὑπὸ τοῦ θείου ἑκατέρου ἡ φύσις

children.definition: Med., introduce into a speech before, premise, Cic. QF 2.3.6.
prefatory summary, Hdn. Fig. p.103 S., Donat. ad Ter. Eun. 719, Serv.ad Verg. A. 1.226, al., Eust. 16.7 (pl.).
by way of preparation, Sch. S. El. 448.
major-domo, JHS 19.298 (Galatia, misspelt -ηκος), Supp.Epigr. 2.747 ( Pisidia).

definition: προοιμιάζομαι, pf. πεπροοιμίασμαι Luc. Nigr. 10:—in Trag. contr. φροιμιάζομαι: both forms occur in Arist. and later Prose: aor. ἐφροιμιασάμην Arist. Po. 1460a10: pf. πεφροιμίασμαι in pass. sense (v. infr.):—

children.definition: make a prelude, preamble, or preface, A. Ag. 1354, X. Mem. 4.2.5, Pl. Lg. 723c; π. μακρῶς Arist. Rh. 1416b33, cf. 1415b24, Phld. Rh. 1.56S., al.

children.label: II
children.definition: say by way of preface, premise, τί φροιμιάζῃ νεοχμόν; E. IT 1162; περὶ οὗ τοσαῦτα προοιμιάζομαι Pl. La. 179a, cf. Thphr. Char.Praef. 4; τούτους . . φροιμιάζομαι θεούς begin by invoking them, A. Eu. 20: c.dat.modi, δάκρυσι Them. Or. 13.173d: pf. in pass. sense, πεφροιμίασται τὰ νῦν εἰρημένα Arist. Pol. 1325b33; ταῦτα ἔστω πεφροιμιασμένα τῷ λόγῳ ib. 1323b37; πεφροιμιάσθω ταῦτα Id. EN 1095a12; ἐν τοῖς πεφροιμιασμένοις Id. Metaph. 995b5.
begin, ἐντεῦθεν Them. Or. 9.120c: metaph., inaugurate, τὴν βασιλείαν τρισχιλίων πολιτῶν φόνῳ J. BJ 2.6.2, cf. D.S. 36.2.
of or for a preface, ἔννοια Aps. Rh. p.238H., cf. Men.Rh. p.438S.; ἐπιχείρησις Longin. Rh. p.205H.
one must premise, D.H. Rh. 2.8, Corn. Rh. p.357 H.: contr. φροιμιαστέον, Arist. Rh.Al. 1440b6, 1445a35.

definition: προοίμιον, τό, Trag. contr. φροίμιον (v. infr.): ( οἶμος):—

children.definition: opening, introduction; in Music, prelude, overture, Pi. P. 1.4; in Ep. poems, proëm, preamble, Id. N. 2.3, Ar. Eq. 1343; in speeches, exordium, Critias 43 tit., Arist. Rh. 1414b19, Phld. Rh. 1.56S., Stoic. 2.96, etc.; προοιμίοις ἡδονῆς with prefaces about pleasure, X. Mem. 2.1.27.

any prelude or beginning, φροίμιον χορεύσομαι A. Ag. 31, cf. 829; φροιμίοις <δυσφροιμίοις> ib. 1216, cf. Th. 7; λόγους . . μηδέπω ʼν προοιμίοις only just beginning, Id. Pr. 741; εἴ τι τοῦδε φ. ματᾷ any part of this presage, Id. Eu. 142; ὁρῶ τάδε φροίμια . . πόνων Id. Supp. 830 (lyr.), cf. E. Hipp. 568, X. Mem. 4.2.3; ἐγχέων π. Pi. Fr. 78; π. δείπνου Alex. 110.3; π. ἔχθρας Plb. 22.4.15; ἀρχῆς Id. 25.3.8 (pl.); δάκρυά μοι τὰ π. τῆς τέχνης Luc. Somn. 3; of premonitory symptoms of disease, Orib. Syn. 8.2.

data.quote: δάκρυά μοι τὰ π. τῆς τέχνης

children.label: II
children.definition: hymn or short poem, such as those attributed to Homer, Ἀπόλλωνος Th. 3.104, cf. Pl. Phd. 60d, R. 531d; φροίμιον Ἀντιλόχου (fort. Ἀρχιλόχου) Call. Fr. 223.
prepare wine first, PRev.Laws 27.8 ( Pass., iii B.C.).
one must premise, place first, Arist. Top. 110b29.
pronounced, uttered, A.D. Pron. 49.20, Adv. 124.14.
to have gone on before, X. Cyr. 7.4.8.
pound in a mortar first, in Pass., Orib. Fr. 93, Aët. 12.32.
make level or even first, Pl. Ti. 50e.
swear before or beforehand, D. 29.57; τοὺς θεοὺς ἦ μὴν ἐλπίζειν . . by the gods, Pl. Lg. 954a; π. ὅρκον Paus. l.c.: c. acc. et inf., προυμόσας τό μʼ εἰδέναι A. Ag. 1196; π. τι εἶναι D. 29.52.

grant or concede beforehand, δοξαστὸν αὐτὸ δεῖν λέγεσθαι Pl. R. 479d:— Pass., προωμολόγηταί τι εἶναι Id. Phd. 93d; τὰ προωμολογημένα things granted beforehand, Id. Tht. 159c:— Med., S.E. M. 1.9, Gal. 4.726.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be betrothed beforehand, J. Ap. 2.24.
previous concession, Olymp. in Phd. p.133 N. (pl.).
one must concede beforehand, Arist. Top. 110b3.
previous agreement, arrangement, τοῦ μισθοῦ Plu. in Hes. 33.
reproach before, Eust. 754.47 ( Pass.).
in priority to Being, τὸ π. ὄν Iamb. Myst. 8.2 (v.l. πρὸ ὄντος).
Pass., Phot. s.v. τριακοντούτης.
roast beforehand, Alex. 149.11.
one must look to, be careful of, σέο τε καὶ σῆς ἀρχῆς Hdt. 1.120.
scout, vedette, οἱ π. τῶν ἱππέων Plb. 29.17.3, cf. Plu. Isid. 2.370a.
of or for foreseeing, Προοπτικόν, τό, title of work by Heraclides, D.L. 5.88.

foreseen, manifest, προόπτῳ θανάτῳ δώσειν τινά Hdt. 9.17, cf. Isoc. 10.27; ἐς προὖπτον κίνδυνον καταστῆσαι Th. 5.99, cf. 111; π. ἀγγέλου λόγος A. Th. 848 (lyr.); ἐς προὖπτον Ἅιδην S. OC 1440, cf. E. Hipp. 1366 (anap.); εἰς προὖπτον . . αὑτὸν ἐνέβαλεν κακόν Aristopho 5; εἰς προὖπτον . . ἐμπεσεῖν κακόν Phoenicid. 4.18.

foreseeing, prevision, ἄνευ-οράσεως καὶ προσδοκίας Phld. D. 1.13; π. θεοῦ Plot. 3.2.1, cf. 6.7.1, Simp. in Ph. 391.32: pl., Them. Or. 11.146b; Σεβαστὴ Π., = Lat. Providentia Augusta, IG Rom. 4.1593 ( Metropolis).
quick at foreseeing, Arist. Div.Somn. 463b15; τῶν ἀδήλων Ph. 2.176; ἧττον εἶ π. τῆς φύσεως Gal. UP 5.8; τὸ π. μέρος τῆς τέχνης the predictive province of astrology, Id. 19.530.
to be foreseen, ἀνθρωπίνῃ προνοίᾳ X. Cyr. 1.6.23.

definition: προοράω, fut. πρόψομαι: pf. προεόρᾱκα: (cf. προεῖδον):—

children.definition: see before one, look forward to, τὰ ἔμπροσθεν X. HG 4.3.23; see what is just before the eyes, Th. 7.44: abs., look before one or forward, εἰς τὸ πρόσθεν Arist. HA 524a14; ὀφθαλμοῖς π. X. Cyr. 4.3.21.

foresee, τὸ μέλλον γίνεσθαι Hdt. 5.24, etc.; π. ὀλίγα περὶ τοῦ μέλλοντος X. Cyr. 3.2.15; ἑαυτοῖς τὸ ἐπιόν Id. Smp. 4.5; πρὸ τῶν πραγμάτων π. οὐδέν D. 4.41, cf. 54.19 ( Pass.): abs., π. διανοίᾳ Arist. Pol. 1252a32.
take thought or care, make provision for . . , σεωυτοῦ Hdt. 5.39; τοῦ σίτου Id. 3.159; ἐκείνων προορῶν, ὅκως . . ἔχωσι Id. 2.121.αʹ: abs., τὸ προορᾶν . . σευ your thoughtfulness, Id. 9.79.
see previously, Act. Ap. 21.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., with pf. and plpf. Pass., look before one, δυοῖν ὀφθαλμοῖν προεωρᾶτο X. Cyr. 4.3.21 (s. v.l.).
foresee, ἐς οἷα φέρονται Th. 5.111; τὸν πόλεμον D. 5.24.
provide for, τὸ ἐφʼ ἑαυτῶν Th. 1.17; ταῦτα Pl. R. 499a; πάνθʼ ἃ προσήκει D. 6.8, etc.; make provision, περὶ τῶν μελλόντων Lys. 33.7; πρός τι D.S. 20.102; π. μή c. inf., cavere ne . . , D. 25.11.
prepare beforehand as for reception of a dye, metaph., Dam. Pr. 427.
determine beforehand, ἡμέραν Hld. 7.24; predetermine, predestine, ἡμᾶς εἰς υἱοθεσίαν Ep.Eph. 1.5; τι γενέσθαι Act.Ap. 4.28; τινὰς συμμόρφους (sc. γενέσθαι) Ep.Rom. 8.29.
Hsch. s.v. οὔρους ( οὖρος and οὐρός confused).
early determination, Hp. Praec. 3.
move forward, push on, X. Cyr. 4.3.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., advance, ib. 1.4.21, HG 5.2.28; of plants, advance, πρὸς αὔξησιν Thphr. CP 1.12.8, cf. 1.10.7, etc.:— Pass., ib. 1.12.6.
sail from an anchorage, Poll. 1.122.
moor or anchor in front, ὁλκάδας πρὸ τοῦ σταυρώματος Th. 7.38.
that prevail before the spring-birds arrive, Gem. Calend. 9.
break loose before, τοῦ λογισμοῦ Them. Or. 1.7c.
dig beforehand, Apollod. Poliorc. 140.6 ( Pass.).
lead the dance, Gloss.
one who leads the dance, among the Thessalians = προαγωνιστής, Luc. Salt. 14.
make water before, π. αἱματῶδες Hp. Epid. 4.29.
first juice from the grapes, Hsch.
prior to Being, π. καὶ ἀρχὴ τῆς οὐσίας Iamb. Myst. 8.2, cf. 10.5; τὸ π. Anon. in Prm. in Rh.Mus. 47.613.

owe beforehand, πολλὰ πολλοῖς D.C. 47.16: metaph., π. κακόν τινι owe one an atonement, i.e. deserve evil at his hands, E. IT 523; κακὸν ταῖς πλευραῖς π. owe oneʼs ribs a mischief, i.e. deserve a beating, Ar. V. 3; π. τι χρηστὸν τῇ πόλει παραινέσαι Id. Lys. 648:— Pass., to be due beforehand, of debts, ὁ προοφειλόμενος φόρος the arrears of tribute, Hdt. 6.59, cf. X. HG 1.5.7; τὸ ληφθὲν προωφέλετο ἱματιοκαπήλῳ Luc. Merc.Cond. 38: generally, ἔχθρη προοφειλομένη ἐς Ἀθηναίους the hatred they had long had reason to feel, Hdt. 5.82; εὐεργεσία προὐφειλομένη a kindness that has long remained as a debt, Th. 1.32; προωφείλετο αὐτῷ κακόν a debt of punishment had long been owing to him, Antipho 5.61, cf. D. 21.77; ἦν μοί τις οὐ μικρὰ π. χάρις Luc. Abd. 15.

data.quote: π. τι χρηστὸν τῇ πόλει παραινέσαι
ἦν μοί τις οὐ μικρὰ π. χάρις

children.label: II
children.definition: to be bound to do, τὸ προὐφείλειν καλῶς πράσσειν . . τούσδε E. Heracl. 240.
first bud of a young vine, Gp. 5.3.3.
before oneʼs eyes, λαβόντες PTeb. 28.18 (ii B. C.).
impregnate before, Phlp. in GA 128.13:— Pass., of eggs, Arist. GA 757b2.
prominent point, eminence, Plb. 4.43.2.
foreseeing, epith. of Apollo, Paus. 1.32.2.
foreseeing, Th. 5.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: seeing before one, οὐκ οὔσης τῆς προόψεως ᾗ . . since there was no seeing where . ., cj. in Id. 4.29 ( προσόψεως codd.).

children.label: III
children.definition: provision, σταθμῶν SIG 880.15 ( Pizus, iii A. D.).

definition: προπαγής, ὀφθαλμοὶ π. f.l. for προπαλεῖς or προπετεῖς in Luc. Musc.Enc. 3.

children.definition: to be passionate beforehand, Sopat. in Rh. 8.58 W.
preliminary experience, anticipation, ἐλπίς ἐστι π. τις Ph. Fr. 17 H.: pl., anticipations of suffering, Plu. QConv. 2.666d; premonitory symptoms of disease, ib. Sanit. 127c.
previous experience, Id. Fr. 7.10.
previous suffering, f.l. for προμάθημα, Hsch. s.v. προπαιδεύματα.
suffering before, f.l. for πραϋπαθής in Ph. 2.595.
preparatory teaching, τῆς π., ἣν τῆς διαλεκτικῆς δεῖ προπαιδευθῆναι which they must receive before entering on dialectic, Pl. R. 536d, cf. Luc. Rh.Pr. 14.
= foreg., ἐγκύκλια π. Ph. 1.157.

definition: προπαίδευσις, εως, ἡ, = foreg., Ascl. in Metaph. 134.12.

children.definition: teach beforehand, in Pass., Pl. R. 536d; πρὸς πάσας . . τέχνας ἔστιν ἃ δεῖ προπαιδεύεσθαι Arist. Pol. 1337a19; ὑπό τινων S.E. M. 6.29.

data.quote: πρὸς πάσας . . τέχνας ἔστιν ἃ δεῖ προπαιδεύεσθαι

children.definition: generate before, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.44.
sport before, Anacreont.App. 2p.352Bgk.
boy in his fourth year, Λέξεις Ἡροδότου in Stein Hdt.ii p.465 (Berol.1871).

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.
very long ago, π. πάλαι πάλαι Ar. Eq. 1155, cf. Plu. QConv. 2.674f, Luc. JTr. 26; πάλαι καὶ π. Them. Or. 2.38a.
very old, οἶνος Orib. 5.33.1; ἔλαιον Aët. 15.14.
keep till old, ἰχθύας Ruf. ap. Orib. 4.2.16.
prominence, ἡ τῶν ὠτίων (fort. ἀγγείων) π. S.E. M. 8.219.

prominent, ὀφθαλμοί Philostr. Gym. 25, Adam. Phgn. 2.2, v.l. in Luc. Musc.Enc. 3; φάρυγξ Philostr. Gym. 30; ἀγγεῖα (blood-vessels) προπαλέστατα prob. for ἀ. προπαλειότητα in Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.78; τὸ π. the presenting part in obstetrics, Sor. 2.64: Comp., more to the front, Id. 1.7; τὸ γένειον προπαλέστερος Poll. 4.138.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -λῶς, = δαψιλῶς, Hsch.
like a great-grandfather, ἀβελτερία Poll. 3.18.
great-grandfather, And. 2.26 codd., Lys. 14.39, Pl. Ti. 20e.
grandfather, M.Ant. 1.4.
before, in front of, Hes. Th. 518, E. Ph. 120 (lyr.).
along, αἰγιαλοῖο A.R. 1.454, 4.1288.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv., before, sooner, rather, A. Supp. 791 (lyr.).
put beside one beforehand, τί τινι Alex.Trall. 11.1:— Med., do so for oneself, λίθους προπαρεβάλοντο σφίσιν Th. 7.5.
announce beforehand, GDI 5040.41 ( Crete), Hld. 9.10: c. inf., D.C. 46.41:— Pass., to be warned before, Aen.Tact. 27.3.
to be present before, Sch. Pl. Grg. 506d.
receive before, PRyl. 214.10 ( Pass., ii A. D.).
explain or set down beforehand, Sor. Fasc. 7 ( Pass.), Orib. 49.25.5 ( Pass.), Sch. Il. 6.401, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: betray beforehand, Gal. 5.310 ( Pass.).
warn beforehand, Gloss.
deprecate in advance, Aps. Rh. p.251 H.
deprecation in advance, Aps. Rh. pp. 258,280 H. (both pl.).
exist already, BGU 243.14 (ii A. D.).
receive from another before, D.C. 49.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: anticipate the menstrual period, Sor. 1.21 (nisi leg. προλαμβ-).

children.label: III
children.definition: προπαραλαμβανόμεναι ὑποθέσεις previously assumed . . , [ Ammon.] in Apr. 67.15.
-ληφθεισῶν τῶν . . ἐμπλάστρων previously employed, Orib. Fr. 49.
to be the antepenultimate, ἡ προπαραλήγουσα (sc. συλλαβή) the antepenultimate, Sch. Ar. Ra. 1455, Eust. 15.34, al.:— Med., π. τῷ o have o in the antepenultimate, EM 308.49.
to be paralysed first, τοῦ νεύρου -λυθέντος Gal. 2.668.
set forth, expound beforehand, S.E. M. 9.293.
to be noted before, Eust. 1133.14, al.

prepare beforehand, ἔρια Pl. R. 429d, cf. Plt. 308d; πάντα τινί X. Mem. 2.2.5; τὰς γνώμας Th. 2.88; τι πρὸς τὴν τροφήν Arist. HA 613a4:— Med., prepare for oneself, ἐντάφια Is. 8.38; ταῦτα περὶ τοὺς Ποτειδεάτας π. Th. 1.57; π. τὸν ὅμιλον for oneʼs purposes, D.C. 38.13: abs., make oneʼs preparations, Aen.Tact. 11.14, Plu. Eum. 6:— Pass., ἐκ πολλοῦ προπαρεσκευασμένοι, εἴ ποτε πολεμήσονται Th. 1.68.

children.definition: one must prepare before, Plu. Sanit. 2.124a.
preparatory, Theo Sm. p.16 H., Philagr. ap. Orib. 5.17.4.
preparation, Hp. Acut. 25 (pl.), Sor. 1.66, Procl. in Prm. p.679S. (pl.); π. futurae litis, Donat. ad Ter. Eun. 495; of τελετή, opp. μύησις, Herm. in Phdr. p.158A.
post in front, στρατὸν τρὸ τοῦ στρατοπέδου D.C. 49.8.
antepenultimate: ἡ π. (sc. συλλαβή), = ἡ προπαραλήγουσα, Gloss.
previous observation, Gal. 19.396.
set on table before, in Med., π. τραγήματα Heraclid. Tar. ap. Ath. 2.53c, cf. eund.ib. 3.120c.
alienate before, CPR 22.15 ( Pass., ii A.D.).
guarantee in advance, Anon. ap. Suid. ( Pass.).
pass already, τοῦ -ελθόντος ε̄ ἔτους PLond. 3.1212.5 (iii A.D.).
offer before, ἐμαυτόν σοι σύμμαχον X. Cyr. 5.5.20; present first, εἰς ὑπόδησιν τὸν δεξιὸν πόδα Iamb. Protr. 21.ιαʹ.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., supply before, μιᾶς ἡμέρας σῖτον X. HG 5.1.18.

definition: προπάροιθε [ᾰ], before a vowel προπάροιθεν ( προπάροιθʼ Od. 24.416, 447, A. Ag. 1020),

children.definition: before, in front of, ὑμείων π. μαχοίατο Il. 4.348; πάντων δὲ π. 16.218; Ἰλίου π. 15.66; Αἰγύπτου π. Od. 4.355; π. ὁμίλου before the assembly, Il. 23.804; π. ποδῶν at oneʼs feet, 13.205; ποδῶν π. Od. 17.357; π. ἀνδρός at a manʼs feet, A. l.c. (lyr.); π. θυράων before the door, i.e. outside, Od. 1.107; Σκαιῶν π. πυλάων Il. 6.307; π. πόλιος, πόληος, 2.811, Hes. Sc. 285; πύργων π. B. 5.148; ἠϊόνος π. before, i.e. along, Il. 2.92; π. νεός in front of, i.e. beyond the ship, Od. 9.482 (opp. μετόπισθε νεός ib. 539): metaph., τῆς ἀρετῆς ἱδρῶτα θεοὶ π. ἔθηκαν Hes. Op. 289.

data.quote: τῆς ἀρετῆς ἱδρῶτα θεοὶ π. ἔθηκαν

children.definition: before the time of, νομίμων π. A. Th. 334 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv.,
before, in front, π. κιών Il. 15.260, cf. Hes. Th. 769; οὐδʼ εἴ οἱ π. . . υἱὸν χαλκῷ δηϊόῳεν before his eyes, Od. 4.225.

data.quote: οὐδʼ εἴ οἱ π. . . υἱὸν χαλκῷ δηϊόῳεν

children.definition: before, first, Il. 10.476, Od. 17.277; σφι π. φάνη μέγα ἔργον ere that, Il. 11.734, cf. Call. Fr. 182; opp. ὀπίσσω, Od. 11.483; τῶν π. εὐγενετᾶν E. Ph. 1510 (lyr.).
one must place the acute accent on the antepenultimate, Sch. Ar. Pax 956.
given to placing the acute accent on the antepenultimate, Αἰολεῖς Eust. 75.37.
pronounce with the acute accent on the antepenultimate, Act. and Pass., A.D. Pron. 30.7, 50.5, al., Hdn.Gr. 2.924, 926, Plu. VOrat. 2.845b.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., have a premature access of fever, Gal. 16.708.
= foreg. Ι, Hsch. s.v. κραταιίς.
use of proparoxytone accentuation, Eust. 1361.39.
with the acute on the antepenultimate, D.T. p.108 U., Theognost. Can. 67. Adv. -νως Hermog. Stat. 2, Phryn. 115.

definition: πρόπας, πᾱσα, πᾰν, in Hom. and Hes. mostly π. ἦμαρ

children.definition: all day long, where πρό ‘on and on’ goes with the verb, Il. 1.601, Od. 9.161, al.; hence πρόπας becomes merely a strengthd. form of πᾶς, once in Hom., νῆας προπάσας all the ships together, Il. 2.493; freq. in Trag., πρόπασα χώρα, γαῖα, A. Pr. 407 (lyr.), Pers. 548 (lyr.); π. δόμος Id. Ag. 1011 (lyr.); πρόπαντος χρόνου Id. Eu. 898; π. στόλος, πότμος, S. OT 169 (lyr.), Ant. 859 (lyr.); πρόπαντα κακὰ κακῶν Id. OC 1237 (lyr.); π. γέννα E. Or. 972 (lyr.); π. ἑσμός Pae.Delph. 14: neut. πρόπαν as Adv., utterly, E. Ph. 1504 (lyr.).
salve, PMasp. 6ii48 (vi A. D.).
vestibule, v.l. for παστάς in Sch. A.R. 1.789; cf. προπάστεον (sic) · τὸν πρὸ τῆς παστάδος τόπον, Hsch.

suffer first or beforehand, Hdt. 7.11, Th. 3.82, etc.; τι S. OC 230 (lyr.), Antipho 2.1.5, Pl. R. 376a; to be ill-treated before, ὑφʼ ἡμῶν Th. 3.67; π. οὐδὲν ἀγαθόν X. Mem. 2.2.5: generally, to be previously affected or modified, Plu. QConv. 2.725a, Plot. 4.5.2.
tread out corn before, PLond. 1.113.523 (i A. D.).

first founder of a family, forefather, Pi. N. 4.89, Hdt. 2.161, 9.122, E. Or. 1441 (lyr.); ὦ Ζεῦ, προγόνων προπάτωρ S. Aj. 387 (lyr., s.v.l.); opp. πατήρ, Pl. Lg. 931d; ancestor of a tribe, OGI 446.3 ( Phrygia); θεὸς ὁ π. Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.44, cf. Id.ib. 3.11.31, IGRom. 4.1213, 1215 ( Thyatira); Διόνυσος ὁ π. τῆς πόλεως D.Chr. 39.8, cf. BCH 4.157 ( Erythrae); primal god, PMag.Par. 1.1988, PMag. Leid.V. 7.26; π. τῶν ἐν γενέσει δημιουργὸν προτάττουσι Iamb. Myst. 8.4: in pl., ancestors, forefathers, Hdt. 2.169, Pl. Lg. 717e; founders, inventors of arts and sciences, Vett.Val. 3.22.

data.quote: π. τῶν ἐν γενέσει δημιουργὸν προτάττουσι

children.definition: stop a process before, π. πρίν . . Hp. Liqu. 1:— Med., D.S. 1.39, Lib. Or. 2.62.
to be persuaded beforehand, Nausiph. 2, Luc. Alex. 17.

previous trial or venture, ἐν Ἀθηναίοισι τὴν πρόπειραν ποιέεσθαι, Lat. periculum facere in . . , Hdt. 9.48; π. ποιεῖσθαι εἰ . . Th. 3.86; π. τινὸς λαμβάνειν Ael. NA 8.22; of a trial in athletic exercises, IG 14.1102.16 (pl.).
= sq., -πειράζοντες δικέλλαις ἀνασκάπτειν Ph. Bel. 100.9; -άσαντες τὸ φάρμακον Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 8.3.7.

definition: προπειράομαι, Med., with aor. and pf. Pass.,

children.definition: try or prove before, τινος Luc. Herm. 53, Vett.Val. 168.1, D.C. 51.11; pf. part. -πεπειραμένος J. AJ 9.4.4, Gal. 13.861.
= sq., λόγος Him. Ecl. 13 tit.; π.ὕμνος a funeral hymn, Philostr. VA 3.49.
accompanying, escorting, used in escorting, λαλιά Men.Rh. p.395 S.; λόγοι Him. Ecl. 10.1; περίοδος Sch. Ar. Eq. 496. Adv. -κῶς Iamb. VP 28.145.

definition: πρόπεμπτος, ον, only neut. pl. πρόπεμπτα as Adv.,

children.definition: five days before, Lex ap. D. 43.75, Lys. Fr. 26S.: c. gen., IG 2(2).1237.61.

send before, send forward or forth, πρό μʼ ἔπεμψεν ἄναξ Il. 1.442; εὖτέ μιν εἰς Ἀΐδαο . . προὔπεμψεν 8.367, cf. Od. 17.54, 117, 24.360; π. κήρυκας Hdt. 1.60, cf. 4.33 ( Pass.), 121, Th. 1.29, S. El. 1158, etc.; π. πρὸ τοῦ στρατεύματος ἄνδρας X. Cyr. 2.4.23:— Med., ib. 5.3.53, An. 7.2.14:— Pass., impers., προπέπεμπται Th. 7.77.

children.label: b
children.definition: τινὶ φήμας π. S. El. 1155; ξίφος afford, furnish, Id. Ph. 1205 (lyr.); π. ἄχη cause, Id. Ant. 1287 (lyr.).
send forth, σποδὸς π. πίονας πλούτου πνοάς A. Ag. 820; ἰοὺς ἀφύκτους καὶ προπέμποντας φόνον S. Ph. 105.

children.label: II
children.definition: conduct, escort, esp. a departing traveller, Hdt. 1.111, 3.50, S. OC 1667, Antipho 1.16, Thphr. Char. 5.2, etc.; τινὰ ἐς δόμους A. Pers. 530; νύμφην π. X. HG 4.1.9, etc.; π. τινὰ χθονός from the land, E. Hipp. 1099; π. τινὰ μέλεσιν καὶ μολπαῖσιν Ar. Ra. 1525 (anap.); π. τινὰ τοῖς ἵπποις X. An. 7.2.8; τοῖς προπέμπουσι καμήλοις Πολύκαρπον PFlor. 206.2 (iii A. D.); esp. follow a corpse to the grave, τινὰ ἐπὶ τύμβῳ A. Th. 1064 (anap.); Καρικῇ μούσῃ τοὺς τελευτήσαντας Pl. Lg. 800e; τιμὰς π. θεοῖς carry offerings in procession, A. Pers. 622: jocosely, τὸν ἕνα ψωμὸν ἑνὶ ὄψῳ π. let one piece of bread be attended by one condiment, X. Mem. 3.14.6:— Pass., Isoc. 4.148; of a funeral procession, -πεμφθέντες κοινῇ ὑπὸ τῆς πόλεως Pl. Mx. 236d; πανδημεὶ προπεμπομένους ἐπὶ θάνατον, of the Minotaurʼs victims, Isoc. 10.27; ὑπὸ ποιητικῆς ἐπὶ φιλοσοφίαν Plu. Aud.poet. 2.37b.
pursue, X. HG 7.2.13.
oneʼs father-in-lawʼs father, Sch.rec. S. OT 1494.
to become concocted prematurely, Hp. Epid. 4.28.
complete before, ἡ πρὸς ἁπάντων -πεπερασμένη γνῶσις A.D. Synt. 26.21.
wrap round first, -ειλημένος ἐρίῳ Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.9.1.
twist round first, Aen.Tact. 31.20.
cleanse all round before, Dsc. Eup. 1.196, Aphrodas ap. Gal. 12.878.
to be previously applied, Sor. 1.76.
wash round before, Sor. 2.86.
scrape all round first, Gal. 13.379, Orib. Fr. 114.
take walking exercise first, Diocl. Fr. 141, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.9.1, Gal. 11.311.
one must circumflex the penultimate, Sch. Ar. Pax 1, etc.

circumflex the penultimate, Gal. 18(2).518 ( Pass.), Sch. Ar. Eq. 21, etc.; προπερισπώμενον, τό, a word circumflexed on the penultimate, Hdn. Gr. 1.10 (pl.). Adv. προπερισπωμένως circumflexed on the penultimate, Sch. Ar. Av. 1655, etc.
incise beforehand round about, Dsc. 3.80 ( Pass.), etc.

definition: προπέρυσι, before a vowel προπέρυ-σιν, Adv.

children.definition: two years ago, Pl. Euthd. 272b, D. 20.33, 33.25, PThead. 16.4 (iv A. D.), cj. in Lys. 9.4, etc.: but πρωπέρυσιν is Att. acc. to A.D. Adv. 166.25, Phryn. PS p.105 B., and is required by the metre in Pherecr. 182.
of the year before last, καρπός Thphr. HP 3.12.4: later προπερσυνός, PSI 1.50.13 (iv/v A. D.).
digest or concoct beforehand, Gal. UP 7.9:— pf. Pass. -πέπεμμαι ib. 14.10; inf. -πεπέφθαι Aret. CD 1.3.
fly before, in aor. -επετάσθην, Ath. 9.395a.
spread out before, ὑμᾶς αὐτοὺς προπετάσαντες ἡμῶν X. Cyr. 4.2.23; κυλικείου τοὐθόνιον προπέπταται Ar. Fr. 104: metaph., σκιαγραφίαν παλιτείας πρὸ τῆς ἀληθείας π. D.C. 52.7.

data.quote: σκιαγραφίαν παλιτείας πρὸ τῆς ἀληθείας π.

children.definition: curtain: metaph., ὁ λόγος μεθέμενος τῶν π. αὐτοπρόσωπος διαλέξεται Them. Or. 13.165c.

children.definition: headlong haste, rashness, Isoc. 5.90, Arist. EN 1150b19; opp. σωφροσύνη, D. 19.251; πρόπου π. Id. 21.38; π. καὶ θρασύτης Id. 22.63, cf. 23.130; π. καὶ ἀπόνοια Id. 44.58; hasty judgement, Gal. Anim.Pass. 2.6; fickleness, Plb. 10.6.2.

to be hasty, S.E. P. 1.20, 205; μηδὲν π. Id. M. 9.49.

definition: προπέτηλον πεποίηται ἀπὸ τοῦ προπίπτειν, Hsch.

children.definition: falling or slipping down in bed, εἰ π. γένοιτο Hp. Prog. 3; π. ἐπὶ πόδας Id. Coac. 487; π. ἂν ἐγίνετο ἡ βάδισις out of control, Arist. IA 712a29, cf. Diocl. Fr. 142.

inclined forward, κεφαλὴ τοῦ βραχίονος π. ἐς τοὔμπροσθεν Hp. Art. 1; -έστεραι γένυες more prominent, ib. 31; ὁ μὲν αὐχὴν . . μὴ π. πεφύκοι X. Eq. 1.8; sloping, of shoulders, Gal. 1.623; stooping, μὴ ὀρθὸς ἀλλὰ μικρῷ -έστερος Arist. Phgn. 807b31.

data.quote: κεφαλὴ τοῦ βραχίονος π. ἐς τοὔμπροσθεν
ὁ μὲν αὐχὴν . . μὴ π. πεφύκοι

children.definition: thrown away, κεῖται προπετές [τὸ κάταγμα] S. Tr. 701.
drooping, at the point of death, ζῇ γὰρ π. ib. 976 (anap.); ἡ π. Μοῖρα untimely, IG 5(1).1355 ( Messenia, ii A. D.).
prominent, of the eyes, Poll. 1.189, Philum. ap. Orib. Syn. 8.10, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.22; γνάθοι, ὀφρῦς, Poll. 4.68, 134.
being upon the point of, πολιὰς ἐπὶ χαίτας π. E. Alc. 909 (lyr.); τύμβου π. παρθένος Id. Hec. 150 (anap.).
ready for, prone to a thing, ἐπί or εἴς τι, X. HG 2.3.15, 6.5.24; πρὸς τὰς ἡδονάς Pl. Lg. 792d: c. inf., -έστατος μεταστῆσαι X. HG 2.3.30.
headlong, π. ἄγειν τὸν ἀκροατήν Arist. Rh. 1409b31.

precipitate, rash, reckless, π. σώματος ἡδοναί Aeschin. 1.191; π. γέλως uncontrolled laughter, Isoc. 1.15; εἴ τι -έστερον ἔπραττον Hyp. Dem. Fr. 6, cf. Men. Pk. 441; ἡ π. ἀκρασία Arist. EN 1150b26; π. βίος Men. 382; π. γλῶσσα Alciphr. 3.57; of a lot, drawn at random, Pi. N. 6.63.

children.label: b
children.definition: οἱ θρασεῖς προπετεῖς Arist. EN 1116a7; τὰ θήλεα . . [τῶν ἀρρένων] -έστερα Id. HA 608b1; μανικὸς καὶ π. ἐπὶ τῶν κινδύνων Theopomp. Hist. 268; οἱ π. Arr. Epict. 4.13.5; οἱ γλώσσῃ προπετεῖς APl. 16.89 (Gall.); τὸ π., = προπέτεια, opp. τὸ σεμνόν, Hp. Medic. 1.
ἁρμονίαι π. flowing rhythms, D.H. Dem. 40.
subject to diarrhoea, Ath. 13.584d ( Comp.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -τῶς headlong, out of control, π. εἰς τὸ κάταντες φέρεσθαι X. Eq. 8.8.

headlong, hastily, π. φέρεσθαι εἰς τὴν τυραννίδα Id. Hier. 7.2; προπετέως ταχυγλωσσότεροι Hp. Epid. 4.45; ἐπερέσθαι π. X. Cyr. 1.3.8, cf. Mem. Epit. 306; ἀποκρίνεσθαι, ἀποφαίνεσθαι, etc., Pl. Phlb. 45a, Isoc. 12.272, etc.; π. ἔχειν to be rash, X. Cyr. 1.4.4 (v.l.); μηδὲν . . πράξῃς π. Men. 574; prematurely, AP 5.144 ( Asclep.); -έστερον χρῆσθαι ταῖς προνομαῖς Plb. 3.102.11.
fly forwards, Arr. An. 3.3.6, Eust. 899.56.
= Lat. decus, Gloss. (s. v.l.).
fix beforehand, pf. imper. Pass., προπεπήχθω πρίν . . Paul.Aeg. 6.120.
προπεπηγὸς δάκρυον congealed before, Dsc. 3.78 (v.l. προσ-).
spring before, τῶν ἄλλων Luc. DMort. 27[19].2.
spring forward, D.S. 17.100, Arr. Tact. 12.4, App. Syr. 35: c. gen., χηραμοῦ Babr. 107.13; τῆς σκηνῆς Hdn. 6.9.1; ἐκ τοῦ ἱεροῦ J. BJ 4.3.12; ἐκ τῶν πυλῶν ib. 5.7.3; ἐς τὴν ἀγοράν Luc. Alex. 13.
protrusion, ὀφθαλμῶν Polem.Phgn. 17.

children.label: II
children.definition: dislocation, gloss on ἐκπάλεια, Sch. Orib. 49.27.

definition: προπηλακίζω, Att. fut. -ιῶ Th. 6.54: (apparently from πήλαξ = πηλός, though neither πήλαξ nor the simple πηλακίζω certainly existed): —

children.definition: bespatter with mud, or trample in the mire: only metaph., treat with contumely, τοὐμὸν στόμα S. OT 427, cf. Ar. Th. 386 ( Pass.); freq. in Att. Prose, Th. l.c., And. 4.16, Pl. R. 562d, etc.:— Pass., Lys. 15.6, etc.; ἰδὼν προπεπηλακισμένην [τὴν φιλοσοφίαν] ἀναξίως Pl. R. 536c; προπηλακισθέντες λόγοις ἢ καὶ ἀτίμοις ἔργοις Id. Lg. 866e; ὑβρίζετο καὶ προὐπηλακίζεθʼ ὑπὸ τοῦ δήμου D. 9.60.

data.quote: προπηλακισθέντες λόγοις ἢ καὶ ἀτίμοις ἔργοις
ὑβρίζετο καὶ προὐπηλακίζεθʼ ὑπὸ τοῦ δήμου

children.label: II
children.definition: throw in oneʼs teeth, reproach one with, εἴ τις πενίαν π. Id. 18.256.
contumelious treatment, τὰς τῶν οἰκείων π. τοῦ γήρως Pl. R. 329b.

data.quote: τὰς τῶν οἰκείων π. τοῦ γήρως

children.definition: = foreg., Hdt. 6.73; ὕβρις καὶ λοιδορία καὶ π. D. 18.12; ὁ τῆς δικαιοσύνης π. Aeschin. 3.258: pl., προπηλακισμοῖς κολάζειν Pl. Lg. 855b, etc.
abusive person, Diog.Oen. 27 (pl.). (This word occurred in Hsch., but only the gloss is preserved in the MS.)
contumelious: Adv. -κῶς D. 30.36.
impact, f.l. in Orib. 50.41 tit.
compress first, v.l. for προσπ- in Paul.Aeg. 1.30 ( Pass.).
previous compression, Paul.Aeg. 6.21 (v.l. προσπ-).

definition: προπῖν or προπεῖν, contr. aor. inf. of προπίνω used as Subst., a

children.definition: drink or snack taken before a meal, ‘cocktail’, Mart. 12.82.11, Petron. 28 (leg. propin esse), CIL 5.5272.13,25 ( Comum), 4449.34 ( Brixia).
popina, Gloss.
jug, ἐλαίον prob. in POxy. 1297.8 ( iv A. D., προ[π]ειν-).
= Lat. popinarius, MAMA 3.168 (Corasium, written πρωπ-).

definition: προπίνω [ῑ], impf. προὔπῑνον: fut. προπίομαι: aor. προὔπῐον: pf. προπέπωκα:—

children.definition: drink before or first, opp. μεταπίνω, Hp. Acut. 56 ( Pass.), Thphr. Od. 48 ( Pass.), Luc. Sat. 18, Ath. 4.156e.
take a snack before dinner, Mart. 5.78.3.
drink up, drain dry, ὅκως ἄμυστιν προπίω Anacr. 63.3: metaph., ψυχὰν τὰν ἐν ἐμοὶ π. drink it in, AP 5.170 ( Mel.):— Pass., ἡ προποθεῖσα κύλιξ Call. Epigr. 37.

children.label: II
children.definition: drink to another, i.e. to his health, pledge him (cf. Ath. 5.193a, 10.432d), φιάλαν . . δωρήσεται . . γαμβρῷ π. Pi. O. 7.4; ᾧ προπιεῖν ἐθέλει Critias Fr. 6.8 D., cf. 33 D.; π. σοι X. An. 7.3.26; also π. φιλοτησίας τινί D. 19.128, cf. Alex. 291; προπινομένη ποίησις Dionys.Eleg. 1.

make a present of the cup to the person pledged, [ ἔκπωμα χρυσοῦν] σοι μεστὸν ἀκράτου προπίομαι Plu. Alex. 39; τὰ ἐκπώματα . . ἐμπιμπλὰς προὔπινε καὶ ἐδωρεῖτο X. Cyr. 8.3.35, cf. Sch. Pi. l.c.: hence,

data.quote: ἔκπωμα χρυσοῦν] σοι μεστὸν ἀκράτου προπίομαι
τὰ ἐκπώματα . . ἐμπιμπλὰς προὔπινε καὶ ἐδωρεῖτο

children.definition: give freely, make a present of, Anacr. 66; ἄλλα τε πολλὰ . . , καὶ ἐκπώματʼ ἀργυρᾶ καὶ χρυσᾶ προὔπινεν αὐτοῖς D. 19.139; π. τὴν ἐλευθερίαν Φιλίππῳ make liberty a drinking-present to Philip, give it carelessly to him, Id. 18.296; sacrifice oneʼs friends, A. Fr. 131 (anap.), E. Rh. 405, PLond. 3.887.5 (iii B.C.); τούτῳ προέπιεν ὁ βασιλεὺς κώμην τινά Steph.Com. 1.1; π. αὐτοῖς τὰς πατρίδας Plu. Arat. 14; αὐτῇ πέντε καὶ εἴκοσι μυριάδας ἀργυρίου Id. Galb. 17; π. σοὶ ἄνδρα Ἕλληνα Philostr. VA 3.28: c. gen. pretii, προπέποται τῆς παραυτίχʼ ἡδονῆς καὶ χάριτος τὰ τῆς πόλεως πράγματα the interests of the state have been sacrificed for mere present pleasure, D. 3.22, cf. App. BC 2.143 (v.l.).

data.quote: ἄλλα τε πολλὰ . . , καὶ ἐκπώματʼ ἀργυρᾶ καὶ χρυσᾶ προὔπινεν αὐτοῖς
τούτῳ προέπιεν ὁ βασιλεὺς κώμην τινά
αὐτῇ πέντε καὶ εἴκοσι μυριάδας ἀργυρίου

children.definition: give to drink beforehand, Hp. Morb. 2.70.
sell before, plpf. 3 sg. προεπεπράκει PMich.Zen. 31.27 (iii B.C.).

fall or throw oneself forward, as in rowing, προπεσόντες ἔρεσσον Od. 9.490, 12.194; π. ἡ κοιλία εἰς τὸ στόμα Arist. HA 507a29; of suppliants, fall prostrate, E. Supp. 63 (lyr.); fall first, in battle, Plb. 1.58.8.

data.quote: π. ἡ κοιλία εἰς τὸ στόμα

children.label: II
children.definition: rush forward, rush headlong, ἐν νάπει S. OC 157 (lyr.); ἐς γαῖαν Theoc. 24.113; burst forth, π. ἡ λίμνη Str. 16.2.44.

rush headlong, Hyp. Fr. 161; εἰς ἄκαιρον γέλωτα, εἰς κίνδυνον, D.S. 13.83, 20.88; to be precipitate, come to a hasty decision, OGI 315.56 (Epist.Attali, ii B.C.): c. inf., π. πλημμελῆσαι M.Ant. 1.17: abs., form a hasty judgement, Stoic term, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.291; π. πρὸ καταλήψεως Stoic. 3.147, cf. Arr. Epict. 2.1.10, etc.; make a slip of the tongue, κἂν-πέσωσιν . . τάχιστα διορθοῦσθαι Phld. Rh. 1.186S.

children.label: III
children.definition: move forwards, advance before the rest, Plb. 1.20.15; οἱ προπίπτοντες, opp. οἱ ἀναχωροῦντες, Id. 28.3.4; project, of a hill, προπεπτωκυῖα ὀφρύς Id. 7.17.1; of an animalʼs snout, ῥύγχη προπέπτωκε Str. 17.3.4; -πεπτωκότες τοῖς μετώποις Id. 11.11.8; τὸ προπῖπτον [τοῦ δόρατος] the projecting part, Ascl. Tact. 5.1: c. gen., project beyond, τὰ μέσα . . προπέπτωκε τῶν κεράτων Plb. 3.115.7, etc.; κλῖμαξ π. τῶν ἐμβόλων Id. 8.4.4; ἡ σάρισσα δέκα πήχεις π. πρὸ τῶν σωμάτων Id. 18.29.4; ἡ ἄκρα ἔξω τῶν στηλῶν π. Str. 2.5.33.

data.quote: ἡ σάρισσα δέκα πήχεις π. πρὸ τῶν σωμάτων
ἡ ἄκρα ἔξω τῶν στηλῶν π.

children.definition: prolapse, ἕδρα -πεσοῦσα Dsc. 2.164; μήτρα προπίπτει Sor. 2.84.

children.label: IV
children.definition: occur, be presented to sense, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1013.7; π. σημεῖα they appear, S.E. M. 8.219 ( προσπ- Bekker): hence, to be obvious, ὅσα π. τῶν ἁμαρτημάτων Plu. Praec. 2.800b.
trust or believe beforehand, D. 23.127, D.H. 11.20, Ph. 1.100:— Pass., προεπιστεύθησαν ἄξιοι εἶναι X. Ages. 4.4.
to be made credible before, pf. προπεπίστωμαι S.E. P. 1.116, M. 8.122, 261; ἐκ φαινομένου π. τὸ ἄδηλον ib. 62.
fall prostrate, ἐς γᾶν A. Pers. 588 (lyr.); of a suppliant, S. El. 1380.
rough draft, Cic. Att. 12.41.4; sculptorʼs clay model, Plin. HN 35.155.
mould or form before, τί τινος Ph. 1.67.
wind, apply a bandage before, aor. part. Pass. -πλᾰκείς Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.43.1.
sail before, Th. 4.120; cf. προπλώω.
fill before, Asclep. ap. Gal. 12.586, Ph. 1.603, Dsc. Alex. Praef. ( Pass.).
strike first, τὴν φόρμιγγα Him. Or. 12.3.
sailing before or in advance, τὰς πρόπλους ναῦς Th. 6.44; τρεῖς νῆες αἱ πρόπλοι ib. 46; αἱ πρόπλοι the leading ships, Isoc. 4.92, App. BC 5.85, etc.
sailing before or forward, App. BC 5.112 (s. v. l.).
wash clean before, Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.7.30:— Pass., pf. inf. -πεπλύσθαι Gal. 18(1).470; part. -πεπλυμένη Dsc. 2.76.
room before the πνιγεύς, Vitr. 5.11.2, Plin. Ep. 2.17.11.
walk in front as a guide, Call. Fr. 1.2P.
going before to show the way, guide, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.580c; σκίπωνα προποδαγόν AP 6.294 ( Phan.): fem. προποδ-ηγέτις, ιδος, Orph. A. 342.

advance the foot, κοῦφα ποσὶ προβιβὰς καὶ ὑπασπίδια προποδίζων Il. 13.158, cf. 806; of a horse, Hld. 3.3; esp. of the direct motion of planets, Sch. Paul.Al. F. 3; opp. ἀναποδίζω, Vett.Val. 34.21, Simp. in Cael. 491.24.

data.quote: κοῦφα ποσὶ προβιβὰς καὶ ὑπασπίδια προποδίζων

children.label: II
children.definition: advance, progress, πρόοδος καθʼ ὑπόβασιν -ποδίζουσα Dam. Pr. 56; ὁ προποδίζων ἀπὸ [τῆς μονάδος] ἀριθμός ib. 57.
process, progression, ἀπὸ μονάδος Moderat. ap. Stob. 1 Coroll. 8; ἀριθμός ἐστι π. πλήθους TheoSm.p.18H.; π. εἰς τὸ ὂν τοῦ ἑνός Dam. Pr. 67.

data.quote: π. εἰς τὸ ὂν τοῦ ἑνός

children.label: II
children.definition: direct motion, of planets, pl., opp. ὑποποδισμοί, Procl. Hyp. 7.4; opp. ἀναποδισμοί, Nicom. Ar. 1.5, Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 440.7.
accomplishing its προποδισμός, of a planet, Vett.Val. 338.6.

do before or beforehand, π. χρηστὰ ἔς τινα Hdt. 1.41; π. τι, opp. προπαθεῖν, D.C. Fr. 54.6, cf. Id. 38.11: abs., μὴ διαφθαρῆναι . . , ἀλλὰ προποιῆσαι make the first move, Th. 3.13:— Pass., τὰ -πεποιημένα works already carried out, IG 7.3073.27 ( Lebad., ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: make beforehand, prepare, προεπεποίητο αὐτῷ προεξέδρη Hdt. 7.44; ὑγίειαν Gal. 5.833.

make war for or in defence of, τῆς χώρας Isoc. 14.33; τῶν ἄλλων Plb. 2.48.1, etc.; τισὶ τῆς ἀρχῆς with . . for . . , D.H. 6.49; ὑπὲρ [τῆς πόλεως] Pl. R. 429b, cf. OGI 56.12 ( Canopus, iii B.C.): abs., οἱ προπολεμοῦντες the guards or defenders of a country, Pl. R. 423a; τὸ προπολεμοῦν ib. 442b, 547d, Arist. Pol. 1279b3; τὸ προπολεμῆσον the body intended to act as guards, ib. 1291a7.
bastion, outwork, π. εἶναι τῆς Ἰταλίας D.S. 14.100.
customary before war, ἱερά D.C. 46.33; τὰ π. ποιῆσαι, θύειν, Id. 50.4, D.H. 3.9.
lying before a city, κόσμος Anon. ap. Suid.; τὰ π., gloss on προάστεια, Sch. Philostr. Im.Prooem. ap. Boissonade ad Marin. Procl. p.140.
instrument of service, π. δάφνας, = πρόπολος δάφνη, E. Ion 113 (lyr.).
A.R. 1.781 ( πρὸ πόληος codd., προπόλοιο PAmh. 2.16).
minister to, θεαῖς Epigr.Gr. 785 ( Cnidus), cf. Phot. s.v. πρόπολος.
= foreg., Apollon. Lex. s.v. γεραιάς, cj. in S. Fr. 535.3 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., speak like a prophetess, Ach.Tat. 4.15.
grow grey before, v.l. in Diod.Cron. ap. S.E. M. 10.114.
grey-haired before his time, Poll. 2.12; προπόλιος τὴν κόμην Sch. Pi. O. 4.32.

children.label: II
children.definition: προπόλιον ἐξ ἑρπύλλου chaplet, dub. in Semus 20.
Cels. ap. Origenes Cels. 4.81 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: bee-glue, Varro RR 3.16.24, Dsc. 2.84, PMag.Par. 1.2379, Aët. 15.14,15.

transact beforehand, τῶν πάντα τὰ καθήκοντα προπεπολιτευμένεν D.C. 52.21: pf. also in pass. sense, τὰ προπεπολιτευμένα the previous measures of his government, Plb. 4.14.7, cf. IG 5(2).515.8 ( Lycosura).

children.label: II
children.definition: hold chief office, π. ἰδιώτης κύκλου βασιλικοῦ Them. Or. 16.205c; πόλεως POxy. 67.2 (iv A.D.), PLips. 37.3 (iv A.D.).
going or acting before:
servant that goes before one, attendant, minister, τυράννων A. Ch. 357 (lyr.): abs., Xenoph. 1.18, E. Hipp. 200 (anap.), Ar. Nu. 436; rower, Pi. O. 13.54.

one who serves a god, esp. one who interprets his will to men, minister, [ Ἑκάτη] οἱ π. ἔπλετο h.Cer. 440; ὄνειρος Ἀΐδα π. v.l. in Ar. Ra. 1333 (lyr.); Ἡσίοδος π. Μουσᾶν B. 5.192; Πίνδαρος . . Πιερίδων π. AP 7.35 ( Leon.); Μουσάων π . . . Ὀρφέα Poet. ap. Alcid. Od. 24; αἰθέρος π . . . πελειαί Simm. ap. Ath. 11.491c; of the Κουρῆτες, Str. 10.3.7.

children.label: b
children.definition: temple-servant, Hdt. 2.63; θεοῦ π. Ar. Pl. 670; Ἐνοδίας E. Hel. 570, cf. AP 6.269 ( Sapph.), Str. 5.3.5, D.H. 1.76.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., c. dat., ministering to, devoted to, ἐπινικίοισιν ἀοιδαῖς Pi. N. 4.79; θεῷ IG 1(2).825.
drink taken before meals, Phylarch. 50J., Plu. QConv. 2.734a, Gal. 6.828.

children.label: II
children.definition: Plu. QConv. 2.624c.—A form πρόπωμα is cited by Hdn.Gr. 2.935, Choerob. in Theod. 1.339; cf. προπουματᾶς.
escorting in procession, conducting, IG 2(2).2788.8, D.Chr. 38.38; written προπομπία, Hierocl. p.58A., Dam. Pr. 81 codd.

children.label: II
children.definition: first place in a procession, IG 42(1).66.65 ( Epid., i B.C.), Delph. 3(2).48.53 (i B.C.), Bull.Soc.Roy.Lund 1928/9 iv 17 ( Thuria, i B.C. /i A.D., -ήα), Hermog. Id. 2.10; written προπομπία, Luc. Am. 18.

go before in a procession, Posidon. 36 J.; βοΐ ἀξίᾳ τῆς θεοῦ Inscr.Prien. 109.215 (ii B.C.); τινος before him or it, Plu. Isid. 2.365b, Luc. Merc.Cond. 25, Hdn. 5.6.8; Ἡλίου Jul. Or. 4.154b: abs., Hdn. 2.8.6; τὸν θεόν POxy. 1381.19 (ii A.D.): metaph., πρό τινος Iamb. Myst. 2.4.
conduct as προπομπός, of Hermes, IG 14.769 ( Naples).
sending forward, αἱ π. τῶν γραμματηφόρων Plu. Galb. 8.

children.label: II
children.definition: escort, π. δόντες μεγαλοπρεπῆ X. Ages. 2.27, cf. Plb. 20.11.8, Plu. Num. 14; π. δημοσία Longin. 28.2.
escorting, esp. in procession, λόχος X. Cyr. 4.5.17: c. acc., χοὰς π. carrying drink-offerings in procession, A. Ch. 23 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., conductor, escort, protector, Id. Pers. 1036 (lyr.), X. Cyr. 3.1.2; of Hermes, Alex. 89; of the Furies, A. Eu. 206; of priestesses of Athena, ib. 1005 (anap.); of attendants in a funeral procession, Id. Th. 1074 (anap.); π. τιρώνων PLips. 35.5 ( iv A.D., cf. Arch.Pap. 3.563).
work or labour beforehand, X. Cyr. 7.5.80; πολλά Luc. Vit.Auct. 23; τινι for another, Id. Hist.Conscr. 16.
work for or instead of another, τινος X. An. 3.1.37, Cyr. 8.2.2.
work for, work so as to obtain, τῶν εὐφροσυνῶν ib. 8.1.32.
obtain by previous labour, τὰ προπεπονημένα Id. Mem. 4.2.23, HG 6.5.40.
elaborate, work up first, τροφὴν οὐκ ὠμὴν, ἀλλὰ προπεπονημένην ὑπὸ τοῦ καυλοῦ καὶ τῶν ῥιζῶν Thphr. CP 4.6.6, cf. EM 73.27.

data.quote: τροφὴν οὐκ ὠμὴν, ἀλλὰ προπεπονημένην ὑπὸ τοῦ καυλοῦ καὶ τῶν ῥιζῶν

children.label: II
children.definition: suffer pain beforehand, ἢν -πεπονηκός τι ᾖ πρὸ τοῦ νοσέειν Hp. Aph. 4.33; π. τῇ νόσῳ, τοὺς νεφρούς, Ruf. Fr. 72, Gal. 19.597 ( Med.); to be wearied before, ἐκ τοῦ τραύματος Luc. JTr. 40; τῷ ἤδη -πεπονηκέναι Agath. 3.27; of a horse, Ael. NA 14.11.

data.quote: ἢν -πεπονηκός τι ᾖ πρὸ τοῦ νοσέειν

children.definition: weary before, ἑαυτούς Plu. Oth. 11:— Pass., to be vexed already, γᾶς -πονουμένας v.l. in S. OT 685 (lyr.).
the Fore-sea, a name given to the Sea of Marmora, that leads into the Pontus, A. Pers. 876 (lyr.), Hdt. 4.85, etc.
those who go in front, advanced guard, Plb. 9.5.8 (pl.).
vanguard, Agath. 2.2.

cause to go before, Ael. NA 10.22:— Pass., with aor. Med., go before, Aen.Tact. 23.10, etc.; π. τινός Arist. Mir. 844b5, Act.Ap. 7.40; πρὸ προσώπου τινός LXX Ex. 32.34, Ev.Luc. 1.76; πρὸ τοῦ στρατοῦ Arr. An. 5.15.1; π. ἐπὶ δύʼ ἡμέραις Plb. 3.52.8; οἱ προπορευόμενοι the van, Id. 2.27.2, etc.; ἡ προπορευομένη, = πρόπολος, Seleuc. ap. Ath. 6.267c; of a river, flow onward, LXX Ge. 2.14 (v.l.).
come forward, Plb. 1.80.8, etc.
to be promoted, advance, πρὸς τὴν στρατηγίαν Id. 28.6.9, cf. 2.4.2.
to be provided beforehand, Luc. Salt. 61, prob. in Cyran. 43.
purple-edged, δελματικομαφόρτης POxy. 1273.16 (iii A.D.).

drinking before or to one, προπόσεις πίνειν drink healths, Alex. 49; πιὼν . . προπόσεις τρεῖς ἴσως ἢ τέτταρας Antiph. 82; π. ἀποδωρεῖσθαι, ὀρέγειν, Critias Fr. 6.3,7 D., al.; λαμβάνειν Plb. 30.26.6, cf. AP 5.133 ( Posidipp.); προπόσεις ἐν τοῖς συμποσίοις ποιεῖν Ath. 10.432d; δεξιοῦσθαι ἀλλήλους ταῖς π. J. AJ 6.14.6, cf. Alciphr. Fr. 6.18.

data.quote: πιὼν . . προπόσεις τρεῖς ἴσως ἢ τέτταρας

children.definition: drink itself, Simon. 167.6; Βρομίου νεκτάρεαι π. BMus.Inscr. 1036 ( Caria).
drinking before food, ὕδατος ἢ οἴνου Aret. CD 1.3 (pl.); sg., Aët. 9.26.
one who drinks healths, προπόται θίασοι bands of revellers, E. Rh. 361 (lyr.).
present as or in a draught, of physicians, Ruf. Fr. 118.12:— Pass., Alex.Trall. 8.2.
cause to drink, τοὺς ἐχιοδήκτους Gp. 13.8.9; ἵππον Hippiatr. 1.
draught, Ruf. Fr. 114.2, Hippiatr. 1, al.

definition: προποτισμός, ὁ, = foreg., Dsc. 2.160 (pl.), Heraclid.Tar. ap. Gal. 11.795 (pl.), Archig. ap.eund. 8.153, Hippiatr. 4.

children.definition: one must administer a draught, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.85, Aët. 7.51.
seller of προπόματα, MAMA 3.698 ( Corycus).
one that has large feet, Phot., Suid.

children.label: II
children.definition: a star in the feet of the Twins ( η Geminorum), Gem. 3.4, Ptol. Alm. 7.5.

children.label: III
children.definition: spur of a mountain, Plb. 3.17.2, 8.13.4, Str. 9.5.8 (pl.), AP 7.501 ( Pers.), etc.; also τοίχων πρόποδες ( πρόσπ- cod.) buttresses, Tim. Lex. s.v. γεῖσα.

children.label: IV
children.definition: sheet of a sail, Sch. A.R. 1.566.

children.label: V

Lys. Fr. 329:—also προ-πράτωρ, ορος, ὁ, Is. Fr. 168, Gloss.

friendly, kindly, Pi. N. 7.86 ( προπραόνʼ cj. Schroeder); προ[πρεόνʼ] ὡς γενέτην suppl. Herwerden in BCH 23.302 ( Termessus).

πρόπωνα εὐκρατῆ, εὔφημα, πρόχειρα, ἑτοῖμα, ἀνεμπόδιστα, Hsch.

efflux, Sch. Nic. Th. 586 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: previous instruction or warning, Th. 1.49.
proclamation, ἐκ προρρήσεως πολεμεῖν D. 9.13; αἱ π. public notices, as in case of trials for murder, Antipho 5.88, 6.6, Pl. Lg. 873b; τὴν π. προαγορεύων ib. 871c.

children.label: III
children.definition: introductory statement, Arist. Rh.Al. 1438b11 (pl.); comment given beforehand, opp. ἐπίρρησις, Phld. Rh. 1.31S.

predictive, δύναμις S.E. M. 5.1; -κόν, τό, a treatise on prognosis, title of two works by Hippocrates, Gal. 14.620, 16.582.
proclaimed, commanded, S. Tr. 684.

by the roots, root and branch, utterly, θάμνοι π. πίπτουσιν Il. 11.157; ὁθʼ . . ἐξερίπῃ δρῦς π. 14.415; [ πολλοὺς] ὁ θεὸς προρρίζους ἀνέτρεψε Hdt. 1.32; κακῶς ἐτελεύτησε π. Id. 3.40; Ζεύς σε . . π. ἐκτρίψειεν E. Hipp. 684, cf. Hdt. 6.86.δʹ; π. ἔφθαρται γένος S. El. 765; [ γένος] οἴχεται π. And. 1.146; δαιμόνων ἱδρύματα π. ἐξανέστραπται βάθρων A. Pers. 812; δίφρων π. ἐκριφθείς S. El. 512 (lyr.); π. αὐτὸς . . ἀπολοίμην Ar. Ra. 587: neut. πρόρριζον as Adv., Arist. HA 616a2 (prob.l.), Lyc. 214.

definition: προρρίπτω, f.l. for προσρίπτω in Iamb. Myst. 3.18.

children.definition: regulate before, Gal. UP 7.5.
flowing forth or first, prob. in Gp. 9.19.8.

on the side of, in the direction of, hence c. gen., dat., and acc., from, at, to: Ep. also προτί and ποτί, in Hom. usually c. acc., more rarely c. dat., and each only once c. gen., Il. 11.831, 22.198:—dialectal forms: Dor. ποτί (q. v.) and ποί, but Cret. πορτί Leg.Gort. 5.44, etc., Argive προτ( ί) Schwyzer 84.3 (found at Tylisus, V B.C.), restored in Mnemos. 57.208 ( Argos, vi B.C.), and in Alcm. 30; Arc., Cypr. πός SIG 306.11 ( Tegea, iv B.C.), Inscr.Cypr. 135.19H., also sts. in Asia Minor in compds., v. ποσάγω, ποσφέρω; Aeol. πρός Sapph. 69 ( προσ-), 109, Alc. 20 (s. v.l.); πρές Jo.Gramm. Comp. 3.10; Pamphylian περτ ( ί) Schwyzer 686.7, 686a4. (With προτί, πρός cf. Skt. práti ‘towards, near to, against, back, etc.’, Slav. protivǔ, Lett. pret ‘against’, Lat. pretium: ποτί (q. v.) and πός are not cogn.) A. WITH GEN., πρός refers to that from which something comes:

children.label: I
children.definition: from, ἵκετο ἠὲ π. ἠοίων ἦ ἑσπερίων ἀνθρώπων Od. 8.29; τὸν π. Σάρδεων ἤλεκτρον S. Ant. 1037 (v.l.).

data.quote: ἵκετο ἠὲ π. ἠοίων ἦ ἑσπερίων ἀνθρώπων

children.definition: on the side of, towards, νήσοισι πρὸς Ἤλιδος towards Elis, Od. 21.347; π. ἁλός, π. Θύμβρης, Il. 10.428, 430; εἶναι π. θαλάσσης Hdt. 2.154; ἱδρῦσθαι π. τοῦ Ἑλλησπόντου Id. 8.120; ἐστρατοπεδεύοντο π. Ὀλύνθου Th. 1.62, etc.; φυλακαὶ π. Αἰθιόπων, π. Ἀραβίων, π. Διβύης, on the frontier towards the Ethiopians, etc., Hdt. 2.30: freq. with words denoting the points of the compass, δύω θύραι εἰσίν, αἱ μὲν π. βορέαο, αἱ δʼ αὖ π. νότου one on the north side, the other on the south side, Od. 13.110; οἰκέουσι π. νότου ἀνέμου Hdt. 3.101; π. ἄρκτου τε καὶ βορέω ἀνέμου κατοικημένοι ib. 102; π. μεσαμβρίης ib. 107; π. τοῦ Τμώλου τετραμμένον τῆς πόλιος (in such phrases the acc. is more common) Id. 1.84; π. Πλαταιῶν Th. 3.21; π. Νεμέας Id. 5.59; ἀπὸ τῆσδε τῆς ὁδοῦ τὸ π. τοῦ λιμένος ἅπαν everything on the harbour- ward side of this road, IG 1(2).892: combined with π. c. acc., π. ἠῶ τε καὶ τοῦ Τανάϊδος Hdt. 4.122; τὸν μέν π. βορέω ἑστεῶτα, τὸν δὲ π. νότον Id. 2.121, cf. 4.17.

data.quote: π. ἠῶ τε καὶ τοῦ Τανάϊδος
τὸν μέν π. βορέω ἑστεῶτα, τὸν δὲ π. νότον

data.quote: μάρτυροι ἔστων π. τε θεῶν μακάρων π. τε θνητῶν ἀνθρώπων

children.label: b
